verses.english: From Ephraim, they marched against the Amalekites. After you, O Benjamin, came against your own peoples, O Amalek. From Machir, leaders descended to join the fight, and from Zebulun came those who led the army.

verses.latin: Et principes Issachar cum Debbora et Barac, et vestigia ejus sequuti sunt, qui in pedes suos direxerunt in vallem: inter divisiones Ruben magnæ cogitationes cordis.
verses.english: The princes of Issachar were with Deborah and Barak. The men of Issachar followed in the footsteps of Deborah and Barak, directing their forces into the valley. But among the divisions of Reuben, there were great hesitations of heart.

verses.latin: Quare sedes inter duas partes, ut audias sibilos gregum? inter divisiones Ruben magnæ inquisitiones cordis.
verses.english: Why did you sit among the two sheepfolds, listening to the whistles of the flocks, Reuben? Among the divisions of Reuben, there were great internal questionings and indecisions of heart.

verses.latin: Galaad trans Jordanem quievit: et Dan cur moratur navibus? Aser habitavit in littore maris, et in portubus moratus est.
verses.english: Gilead stayed across the Jordan River and remained there. Why did Dan linger by his ships? Asher settled on the seashore and remained in his harbors, not joining the battle.

verses.latin: Zabulon vero et Nephthali obtulerunt animas suas morti in regione Merome.
verses.english: But Zebulun and Naphtali risked their lives, offering themselves to death, in the region of Merom.

verses.latin: Venerunt reges et pugnaverunt, pugnaverunt reges Chanaan in Thanach juxta aquas Mageddo, et nihil tulerunt prædantes pecuniæ.
verses.english: The kings came and fought. The kings of Canaan fought at Taanach, near the waters of Megiddo. But they took no plunder of silver; they gained nothing from their looting.

verses.latin: De cœlo pugnatum est contra eos, stellæ manentes in ordine et cursu suo, adversus Sisaram pugnaverunt.
verses.english: From the sky, the battle was waged against them. The stars, remaining in their fixed order and moving in their courses, fought against Sisara.

verses.latin: Torrens Cison traxit cadavera eorum, torrens Cadumim, torrens Cison: conculca, anima mea, fortes.
verses.english: The Kishon River swept away their dead bodies; that ancient river, the Kishon River. My soul, trample down the mighty warriors!

verses.latin: Ungulæ equorum concitatæ sunt, fugientibus impetu fortissimis.
verses.english: The hooves of the horses pounded furiously, as the mightiest warriors fled in a frenzy.

verses.latin: Maledicite terræ Meroz, dixit angelus Domini: maledicite habitatoribus ejus, quia non venerunt ad auxilium Domini, in adjutorium ejus cum fortissimis.
verses.english: “Curse Meroz!” said the Angel of the Lord. “Curse its inhabitants, because they did not come to the aid of the Lord, to help Him alongside the mightiest warriors.”

verses.latin: Benedicta inter mulieres Jahel sit, uxor Haber Cinei: benedicatur in tabernaculo suo.
verses.english: May Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite, be blessed above all women. May she be blessed within her tent, in her home.

verses.latin: Aquam petiit, lac dedit: in phiala principum obtulit butyrum.
verses.english: He asked for water, but she gave him milk. In a bowl fit for a prince, she offered him curdled milk or butter, a thick, rich drink.

verses.latin: Sinistram manum misit ad clavum, et dextram ad fabrorum malleum, et percussit Sisaram quærens in capite vulnus, et configens tempora ejus.
verses.english: She reached out her left hand for a tent peg, and her right hand for a workman's hammer. She struck Sisara, seeking to inflict a wound to his head, and pierced through his temples.

verses.latin: Inter pedes ejus ruit, defecit, et mortuus est: inter pedes ejus cecidit, ibique jacebat exanimis.
verses.english: Between her feet he sank down, he faltered, and then he died. Between her feet he collapsed, and there he lay lifeless.

verses.latin: Per fenestram prospiciebat mater Sisarae, et ululabat, ac de solario loquebatur: Cur moratur currus ejus reverti? quare tardaverunt pedes quadrigarum ejus?
verses.english: Through the window, Sisara's mother looked out and cried loudly. From the rooftop, she spoke, saying: “Why is his chariot so long in returning? Why have the hoofbeats of his chariots been delayed?”

verses.latin: Una sapientior ceteris uxoribus ejus respondit illi, et ipsa ad verba matris suæ locuta est:
verses.english: One of her wisest wives answered her, and she too spoke to her mother's words, providing an explanation:

verses.latin: Forsitan nunc dividit spolia, et pulcherrima quæque vestium: et varia pictura vestium, ad colla prædae, unicuique capiti virorum spolia singula.
verses.english: “Perhaps he is now dividing the plunder. There will be the most beautiful of garments, and brightly embroidered cloths, to adorn the necks of the captives. For each man, there will be a single spoil to take home.”

verses.latin: Sic pereant omnes inimici tui, Domine: qui autem diligunt te, sicut sol refulgens procedat in virtute sua. Quievitque terra per quadraginta annos.
verses.english: May all your enemies perish in this way, O Lord! But may those who love you shine forth like the sun, going out in its full strength. And so, the land had peace for forty years.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israel fecerunt malum in conspectu Domini: qui tradidit eos in manu Madian septem annis.
verses.english: But the sons of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, and because of this, He delivered them into the power of Midian for seven years.

verses.latin: Et oppressi sunt vehementer ab eis. Et fecerunt sibi filii Israel propter Madian speluncas in montibus, et cavernas, et munitissima loca.
verses.english: And they were severely oppressed by Midian. Because of this, the sons of Israel made for themselves caves in the mountains, hollows in the ground, and many fortified strongholds.

verses.latin: Cumque sevisset Israel, ascendebat Madian, et Amalec, et ceteri orientales:
verses.english: Whenever Israel had sown their crops, Midian and Amalek and the other peoples from the East would invade their land.

verses.latin: et vallantes universa exterminabant usque ad Gazam: nec relinquebant ex omnibus Israël alimenta, et ovium, et boum, et asinorum.
verses.english: They would spread out and devastate the entire region, destroying everything as far as Gaza. They would leave nothing for the people of Israel to eat, neither sheep, oxen, nor donkeys.

verses.latin: Ipsi enim et universi greges eorum veniebant cum tentoriis suis, et instar locustarum implebant omnia: innumerabiles erant homines et cameli, et quocumque introissent, cuncta vastabant.
verses.english: For they themselves would come with their tents and their entire herds, and like swarms of locusts, they would fill up the land. The men and their camels were innumerable, and wherever they went, they devastated everything.

verses.latin: Et humiliatus est Israël valde in conspectu Madian. Et clamaverunt ad Dominum filii Israël.
verses.english: And so, Israel was brought very low and humbled before Midian. And the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord for help.

verses.latin: Cumque clamassent ad Dominum propter Madian:
verses.english: And when they had cried out to the Lord because of Midian,

verses.latin: misit Dominus prophetam ad eos, qui locutus est hæc: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Ego feci vos ascendere de terra Ægypti, et eduxi vos de domo servitutis,
verses.english: the Lord sent a prophet to them, who spoke these words: "Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: 'I made you ascend from the land of Egypt and led you out of that house of slavery.

verses.latin: et erui vos de manu Ægyptiorum, et de manu omnium inimicorum vestrorum, qui afflixerunt vos: et ejeci eos a facie vestra, et dedi vobis terram eorum.
verses.english: I rescued you from the power of the Egyptians and from the power of all your enemies who afflicted you. I drove them out from before you and gave their land to you.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Ego Dominus Deus vester, ne timeatis deos Amorrhæorum, in quorum terra habitatis. Et noluistis audire vocem meam.
verses.english: And I said: "I am the Lord your God. Do not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you are now living." But you would not listen to My voice.'"

verses.latin: Venit autem Angelus Domini, et sedit sub quercu quæ erat in Ephra, et pertinebat ad Joas patrem familiæ Ezri. Cumque Gedeon filius ejus excuteret atque purgaret triticum in torculari, ne a Madianitis videretur:
verses.english: Now the Angel of the Lord came and sat under an oak tree that was in Ephra, which belonged to Joas, the father of the family of Ezri. And his son, Gideon, was threshing and cleaning wheat in a winepress to hide it from the Midianites.

verses.latin: apparuit ei Angelus Domini, et ait: Dominus tecum, virorum fortissime.
verses.english: The Angel of the Lord appeared to him and said: "The Lord is with you, O mighty warrior."

verses.latin: Dixitque Gedeon ad eum: Obsecro Domine mi, si est Dominus nobiscum, cur apprehendunt nos hæc omnia? ubi sunt omnia mirabilia ejus, quæ narraverunt patres nostri, atque dixerunt: De Ægypto eduxit nos Dominus? nunc autem dereliquit nos Dominus, et tradidit in manu Madian.
verses.english: And Gideon said to Him: "Please, my Lord, if the Lord is with us, why have all these things happened to us? Where are all His miracles that our fathers told us about, saying: 'The Lord led us out of Egypt?' But now the Lord has abandoned us and delivered us into the power of Midian."

verses.latin: Respexitque ad eum Dominus, et ait: Vade in hac fortitudine tua, et liberabis Israël de manu Madian: scito quia ego misi te.
verses.english: And the Lord looked at him and said: "Go in this strength of yours, and you will deliver Israel from the power of Midian. Know for certain that I Myself have sent you."

verses.latin: Qui respondens ait: Obsecro Domine mi, in quo liberabo Israël? ecce familia mea humillima est in Manasse, et ego minimus in domo patris mei.
verses.english: And Gideon, responding, said: "Please, my Lord, how shall I deliver Israel? Behold, my family is the poorest in Manasseh, and I am the least significant in my father's house."

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Dominus: Ego ero tecum: et percuties Madian quasi unum virum.
verses.english: And the Lord said to him: "I will be with you. And you will strike down Midian as if they were only one man."

verses.latin: Et ille: Si inveni, inquit, gratiam coram te, da mihi signum, ut tu sis qui loqueris ad me.
verses.english: And Gideon said: "If I have found favor in your sight, give me a sign to prove that it is You who are speaking to me."

verses.latin: Ne recedas hinc, donec revertar ad te, et afferam sacrificium meum, et ponam coram te. Qui respondit: Ego præstolabor adventum tuum.
verses.english: "Do not depart from here until I return to You and bring my offering and set it before You." And He replied: "I will wait for your return."

verses.latin: Ingressus est ergo Gedeon, et coxit hædum, et de farinæ modio azymos panes: carnesque posuit in canistro, et jus in olla. Et exiens obtulit omnia sub quercu.
verses.english: So Gideon went in and prepared a young goat, and from an ephah of flour, he made unleavened bread. He put the meat in a basket and the broth in a pot. Then he brought it all out and offered it under the oak tree.

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Angelus Domini: Tolle carnes et azymos panes, et pone super illam petram, et jus desuper funde. Cumque fecisset ita:
verses.english: And the Angel of the Lord said to him: "Take the meat and the unleavened bread, and place them on that rock, and pour the broth over them." And when he had done so,

verses.latin: extendit Angelus Domini summitatem virgæ quam tenebat in manu sua, et tetigit carnes et azymos panes: egressusque est ignis de petra, et consumpsit carnes et azymos panes: et Angelus Domini evanuit ab oculis ejus.
verses.english: the Angel of the Lord stretched out the tip of the staff that He held in His hand and touched the meat and the unleavened bread. Then fire came out from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread, and the Angel of the Lord vanished from his sight.

verses.latin: Vidensque Gedeon quod esset Angelus Domini, ait: Heu mihi Domine Deus, quia vidi Angelum Domini facie ad faciem.
verses.english: And when Gideon saw that it had been the Angel of the Lord, he said: "Alas, my Lord God! For I have seen the Angel of the Lord face to face!"

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Dominus: Pax tecum: ne timeas, non morieris.
verses.english: And the Lord said to him: "Peace be with you. Do not fear; you will not die."

verses.latin: Ædificavit ergo ibi Gedeon altare Domino, vocavitque illud Domini pax, usque in præsentem diem. Cum adhuc esset in Ephra familia Ezri.
verses.english: So Gideon built an altar there to the Lord, and he called it "The Lord is Peace" (Yahweh Shalom), even to this present day. This occurred while he was still in Ephra, which belonged to the family of Ezri.

verses.latin: Nocte illa dixit Dominus ad eum: Tolle taurum de armento patris tui, et alterum taurum annorum septem, et destrue aram Baal quam habet pater tuus, et lucum qui in circuitu est succide.
verses.english: That same night, the Lord said to him: "Take a bull from your father's herd, and another bull that is seven years old. Then tear down the altar of Baal that your father has, and cut down the sacred grove of trees that is around it."

verses.latin: Et ædifica altare Domino Deo tuo in summo hujus petræ, super quam prius obtulisti: et tollo lignorum, quæ succideris de luco, holocaustum offeres.
verses.english: "And build an altar to the Lord your God on the top of this rock, the very one upon which you made your offering earlier. Then, using the wood that you cut down from the sacred grove, offer a burnt offering."

verses.latin: Assumptis itaque Gedeon decem viris de servis suis, fecit sicut præceperat Dominus: timensque domum patris sui, et homines illius civitatis, per diem facere noluit, sed omnia nocte complevit.
verses.english: So Gideon took ten men from among his servants and did just as the Lord had commanded him. But because he was afraid of his father's household and the men of that city, he would not do it by day; instead, he completed everything during the night.

verses.latin: Cumque surrexissent viri civitatis ejus mane, viderunt destructam aram Baal, et lucum succisum, et taurum immolatum super aram, quæ nuper fuerat ædificata.
verses.english: And when the men of his city rose early in the morning, they saw that the altar of Baal had been destroyed, the sacred grove cut down, and a bull offered as a sacrifice on the altar that had just been built.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad invicem: Quis hoc fecit? Cumque perquirerent auctorem facti, dictum est: Gedeon filius Joas fecit omnia hæc.
verses.english: And they said to one another: "Who did this?" And when they investigated to find the one responsible for the deed, it was said: "Gideon, the son of Joas, did all these things."

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad Joas: Produc filium tuum huc, ut moriatur: quia destruxit aram Baal, et succidit lucum.
verses.english: And they said to Joas: "Bring out your son here, so that he may die, because he destroyed the altar of Baal and cut down the sacred grove."

verses.latin: Qui respondit eis: Numquid ultor vultis esse Baal, et pugnare pro eo? qui adversarius fuerit ejus, moriatur antequam lux crastina veniat. Si Deus est, vindicet se de eo qui suffodit aram ejus.
verses.english: But Joas responded to them: "Are you going to avenge Baal and fight for him? Whoever opposes him, let him die before tomorrow's light arrives. If Baal is a god, let him avenge himself on the one who tore down his altar."

verses.latin: Ex illo die vocatus est Gedeon Jerobaal, eo quod dixisset: Certet cum eo Baal, quia suffodit aram ejus.
verses.english: From that day forward, Gideon was called Jerobaal, which means "Baal Contends," because Joas had said: "Let Baal contend with him, because he tore down his altar."

verses.latin: Igitur omnis Madian, et Amalec, et orientales populi, congregati sunt simul: et transeuntes Jordanem, castrametati sunt in valle Jezrael.
verses.english: Then all of Midian, and Amalek, and the peoples from the East gathered together. They crossed the Jordan River and camped in the Valley of Jezreel.

verses.latin: Spiritus autem Domini induit Gedeon: qui clangens buccina, convocavit domum Abiezer ut sequeretur se.
verses.english: But the Spirit of the Lord came upon Gideon, strengthening him for battle. And Gideon blew the trumpet, summoning the house of Abiezer to follow him.

verses.latin: Misitque nuntios in universum Manasse, qui et ipsi eum secuti sunt: et alios in Aser et Zabulon et Nephtali, qui occurrerunt ei.
verses.english: He also sent messengers throughout all of Manasseh, and they too followed him. And he sent others into Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, and they came to meet him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Gedeon ad Dominum: Si salvas per manum meam Israël, sicut locutus es,
verses.english: And Gideon said to the Lord: "If You truly intend to save Israel by my hand, as You have spoken,

verses.latin: ecce vellus lanæ ponam in area: si ros in vellere solo fuerit, et in omni terra siccitas, sciam quia per manum meam, sicut locutus es, liberabis Israël.
verses.english: behold, I will place a fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If there is dew only on the fleece, and the ground all around it is dry, then I will know that You will deliver Israel by my hand, as You have spoken."

verses.latin: Factumque est ita. Et de nocte consurgens, exprimensque vellus, rorem de vellere concam plenam aquæ extulit.
verses.english: And it happened just so. For when Gideon rose early the next morning and squeezed the fleece, he wrung out enough dew from the fleece to fill a bowl with water.

verses.latin: Dixitque rursus ad Dominum: Ne irascatur furor tuus contra me Domine, si adhuc semel tentavero, signum quærens in vellere: oro ut solum vellus siccum sit, et omnis terra rore madens.
verses.english: And Gideon said again to the Lord: "Do not let your anger burn against me, Lord, if I try just one more time, seeking a sign with the fleece. I pray that only the fleece may be dry this time, and all the ground around it be wet with dew."

verses.latin: Fecitque Deus nocte illa sicut petierat: et siccitas fuit in vellere solo, et in omni terra ros.
verses.english: And God did so that night as he had requested. Only the fleece was dry, and all the ground around it was covered with dew.

verses.latin: Feceruntque filii Israël malum in conspectu Domini: et tradidit eos in manu Madian septem annis.
verses.english: The children of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. Therefore, the Lord gave them into the power of Midian for seven years.

verses.latin: Et oppressi sunt vehementer ab eo: prævalidueruntque contra Israël.
verses.english: The Midianites severely oppressed them, and they gained complete dominance over Israel.

verses.latin: Cumque sevisset Israël, ascendebat Madian, et Amalec, et ceteri orientales nationes:
verses.english: Whenever Israel had planted their crops, Midian, Amalek, and the other Eastern peoples would invade.

verses.latin: Et suam parabant contra eos caulas: et omnia quæ sernuntur in terra, usque ad Gazam, depastis erant: nec remanebat quidquam in Israël, nec alimonia jumentorum, nec ovium, nec boum.
verses.english: They would establish their camps against Israel, and they would eat up everything that was sown in the land, all the way to Gaza. Nothing would be left in Israel for sustenance, neither for their livestock, nor sheep, nor cattle.

verses.latin: Omnes enim cum gregibus et tentoriis suis veniebant, quasi locustarum multitudo, et irrepentibus cunctis, universa vastabant.
verses.english: For all of them would come with their flocks and their tents, like a multitude of locusts. As they swarmed in, they would devastate everything.

verses.latin: Humiliatusque est Israël valde in conspectu Madian.
verses.english: So Israel was greatly humbled and brought low before Midian.

verses.latin: Et clamavit ad Dominum: postulans auxilium contra Madianitas.
verses.english: And Israel cried out to the Lord, pleading for help against the Midianites.

verses.latin: Qui misit ad eos virum prophetam, et locutus est hæc: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Ego feci vos ascendere de Ægypto, et eduxi vos de domo servitutis,
verses.english: The Lord sent a prophet to them, who spoke these words: 'Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: I caused you to come up out of Egypt, and I led you out of the house of slavery.'

verses.latin: Et erui de manu Ægyptiorum, et omnium inimicorum vestrorum: ejecique eos a facie vestra, et dedi vobis terram eorum.
verses.english: 'I rescued you from the power of the Egyptians and from the power of all your enemies. I drove them out from before you, and I gave you their land.'

verses.latin: Et dixi: Ego Dominus Deus vester, ne timeatis deos Amorrhæorum, in quorum terra habitatis. Et noluistis audire vocem meam.
verses.english: 'And I said: I am the Lord your God. Do not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you live. But you have not obeyed my voice.'

verses.latin: Venit autem Angelus Domini, et sedit sub quercu quæ erat in Ephra, et pertinebat ad Joas patrem familiæ Ezri. Cumque Gedeon filius ejus excuteret atque purgaret triticum in torculari, ut fugeret Madian,
verses.english: Now the Angel of the Lord came and sat under an oak tree which was in Ephra, and which belonged to Joas, of the family of Ezri. His son, Gideon, was threshing and cleaning wheat in a winepress, so that he could hide it from the Midianites.

verses.latin: Apparuit ei Angelus Domini, et ait: Dominus tecum, fortissime virorum.
verses.english: The Angel of the Lord appeared to him and said: 'The Lord is with you, O mightiest of warriors!'

verses.latin: Dixitque Gedeon ad eum: Obsecro Domine mi, si est Dominus nobiscum, cur apprehenderunt nos hæc omnia? ubi sunt omnia mirabilia ejus, quæ narraverunt patres nostri, atque dixerunt: De Ægypto eduxit nos Dominus? nunc autem dereliquit nos Dominus, et tradidit in manu Madian.
verses.english: Gideon then said to him: 'Please, my Lord, if the Lord is with us, why has all this trouble come upon us? Where are all His wondrous works, which our fathers told us about, saying: "The Lord brought us out of Egypt"? But now the Lord has abandoned us and delivered us into the power of Midian.'

verses.latin: Respexitque ad eum Dominus, et ait: Vade in hac fortitudine tua, et liberabis Israël de manu Madian: scito quia ego misi te.
verses.english: The Lord looked at him and said: 'Go in this strength of yours, and you shall deliver Israel from the power of Midian. Know for certain that I Myself have sent you.'

verses.latin: Qui respondens ait: Obsecro Domine mi, in quo liberabo Israël? ecce familia mea humillima est in Manasse, et ego minimus in domo patris mei.
verses.english: Gideon replied: 'Please, my Lord, how can I deliver Israel? Behold, my family is the humblest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father's house.'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Dominus: Ego ero tecum: et percuties Madian quasi unum virum.
verses.english: The Lord then said to him: 'I will be with you. You shall strike down Midian as if they were a single man.'

verses.latin: Et ille: Si inveni, inquit, gratiam coram te, da mihi signum, ut tu sis qui loqueris ad me.
verses.english: Gideon said: 'If I have found favor in your sight, then give me a sign that it is truly you who speaks with me.'

verses.latin: Ne recedas hinc, donec revertar ad te, portans sacrificium, et offerens tibi. Qui respondit: Ego præstolabor adventum tuum.
verses.english: 'Do not leave here until I return to you, bringing my offering and presenting it to you.' The Angel replied: 'I will wait for your return.'

verses.latin: Ingressus est itaque Gedeon, et coxit hædum, et de farinæ modio azyma: carnesque posuit in canistro, et jus foras simul effudit in ollam. Et attulit sub quercum, et obtulit ei.
verses.english: So Gideon went in and cooked a young goat, and from a measure of flour he made unleavened bread. He put the meat in a basket and poured the broth out into a pot separately. He brought it all out under the oak tree and offered it to the Angel.

verses.latin: Cui dixit Angelus Domini: Tolle carnes, et azyma, et pone super illam petram, et jus desuper effunde. Cumque fecisset ita,
verses.english: The Angel of the Lord said to him: 'Take the meat and the unleavened bread and place them upon that rock, and pour the broth over them.' When Gideon had done so,

verses.latin: Extendit Angelus Domini summitatem virgæ quam tenebat in manu: et tetigit carnes, et azymos panes: surrexitque ignis de petra, et carnes azymosque consumpsit: et Angelus Domini evanuit ab oculis ejus.
verses.english: the Angel of the Lord extended the tip of the staff that He held in His hand, and touched the meat and the unleavened bread. Fire then rose from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread. And the Angel of the Lord vanished from his sight.

verses.latin: Vidensque Gedeon quod esset Angelus Domini, ait: Heu mihi Domine Deus, quia vidi Angelum Domini facie ad faciem.
verses.english: When Gideon saw that it was indeed the Angel of the Lord, he cried out: 'Alas for me, O Lord God! For I have seen the Angel of the Lord face to face!'

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Dominus: Pax tecum: ne timeas, non morieris.
verses.english: But the Lord said to him: 'Peace be with you. Do not be afraid. You shall not die.'

verses.latin: Ædificavit ergo ibi Gedeon altare Domino, vocavitque illud Domini pax, usque in præsentem diem. Cum adhuc esset in Ephra familiæ Ezri.
verses.english: So Gideon built an altar there to the Lord, and he called it 'The Lord is Peace' (or 'Yahweh Shalom'). It stands even to this present day in Ephra, where the family of Ezri lives.

verses.latin: Nocte illa dixit Dominus ad eum: Tolle taurum patris tui, et alterum taurum de annis septem, et destrue aram Baal, quæ est patris tui, et lucum qui in circuitu ejus est, succide:
verses.english: On that very night, the Lord said to Gideon: 'Take your father's bull, and another bull that is seven years old. Tear down the altar of Baal that belongs to your father, and cut down the sacred grove that is around it.'

verses.latin: Et ædifica altare Domino Deo tuo in summo hujus petræ, super quam ante sacrificium posueras: tollesque ligna de luco quæ succideris, et offeres holocaustum.
verses.english: 'Then build an altar to the Lord your God on the top of this rock, upon which you previously placed your offering. Take the wood from the sacred grove that you have cut down, and offer a burnt offering.'

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Gedeon decem viros de servis suis, fecitque sicut præceperat Dominus. Timens vero domum patris sui, et homines illius civitatis, per diem facere noluit: sed omnia nocte complere curavit.
verses.english: So Gideon took ten men from among his servants and did as the Lord had commanded him. However, because he was afraid of his father's household and the men of that city, he did not want to do it by day. Instead, he made sure to complete everything by night.

verses.latin: Cum surrexisset autem mane viri de civitate, viderunt destructam aram Baal, et lucum succisum, et taurum immolatum in altari quod noviter fuerat ædificatum.
verses.english: When the men of the city rose early in the morning, they saw that the altar of Baal was torn down, the sacred grove was cut down, and the bull had been offered as a sacrifice on the altar that had just been built.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad invicem: Quis hoc fecit? Cumque perquirerent auctorem facti, dictum est: Gedeon filius Joas fecit hæc omnia.
verses.english: They said to one another: 'Who did this?' When they inquired diligently to find the one who had done it, it was told to them: 'Gideon, the son of Joas, did all these things.'

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ad Joas: Educ filium tuum ut moriatur: quia destruxit aram Baal, et succidit lucum.
verses.english: They then said to Joas: 'Bring out your son so that he may die! For he has torn down the altar of Baal and cut down the sacred grove!'

verses.latin: Qui respondit his, qui adversus eum loquebantur: Numquid vos de Baal pugnatis, ut propter eum pugnetis? qui steterit pro illo, moriatur antequam dies illucescat: si Deus est, vindicet se de eo qui suffodit aram ejus.
verses.english: Joas answered those who were speaking against him: 'Will you fight for Baal? Will you contend on his behalf? Whoever stands up for him shall die before morning! If he is a god, let him contend for himself against the one who destroyed his altar!'

verses.latin: De illo itaque die vocatus est Gedeon Jerobaal, eo quod dixisset: Judicet eum Baal, quia suffodit aram ejus.
verses.english: From that day on, Gideon was called Jerobaal (which means, 'Let Baal contend'), because Joas had said: 'Let Baal contend with him, since he tore down his altar.'

verses.latin: Igitur omnis Madian, et Amalec, et orientales populi, congregati sunt simul: et transeuntes Jordanem, castrametati sunt in valle Jezrael.
verses.english: Then all of Midian, Amalek, and the peoples of the East gathered together. They crossed the Jordan River and camped in the valley of Jezrael.

verses.latin: Spiritus vero Domini induit Gedeon: qui clangens buccina, convocavit domum Abiezer ut sequeretur se.
verses.english: But the Spirit of the Lord empowered Gideon. He sounded the trumpet, calling the household of Abiezer to follow him.

verses.latin: Misitque nuntios in universam Manassen, qui et ipsa vocata est ad sequendum eum: et alios in Aser, et Zabulon, et Nephthali, qui occurrerunt ei.
verses.english: He also sent messengers throughout all Manasseh, and they too were called to follow him. He sent messengers to Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, and they came out to meet him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Gedeon ad Deum: Si salvum facis per manum meam Israël, sicut locutus es,
verses.english: Gideon then said to God: 'If you are truly going to save Israel by my hand, as you have spoken,'

verses.latin: Ego ponam hoc vellus lanæ in area: si ros in solo vellere fuerit, et omnis terra sicca, sciam quia per manum meam, sicut locutus es, liberabis Israël.
verses.english: 'I will place this fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If there is dew only on the fleece, and all the ground around it is dry, then I will know that you will deliver Israel by my hand, as you have spoken.'

verses.latin: Factumque est ita. Et de nocte consurgens, exprimens vellus, concam rore plena repperit.
verses.english: And so it happened. When he rose early the next morning, he squeezed the fleece and found a bowl full of dew.

verses.latin: Dixitque rursus ad Deum: Ne irascaris contra me Domine, si adhuc semel tentavero, signum quærens in vellere: ut solum vellus siccum sit, et omnis terra rore madens.
verses.english: Gideon spoke to God again: 'Do not be angry with me, Lord, if I test you just one more time, seeking a sign with the fleece. Let only the fleece be dry, and let all the surrounding ground be wet with dew.'

verses.latin: Fecitque Deus nocte illa sicut petierat: et siccum fuit vellus solum, et in omni terra ros erat.
verses.english: And God did so that night as Gideon had requested. Only the fleece was dry, and there was dew on all the ground around it.

verses.latin: Ierobaal autem, qui et Gedeon, et omnis populus cum eo de nocte surrexerunt, et castrametati sunt juxta fontem Harad. Castra Madian erant ab aquilone, vallis in conspectu eorum.
verses.english: Jerubbaal, who was also called Gideon, and all the people with him rose during the night. They then set up their camp next to the Spring of Harad. The Midianite camp was located to the north of them, visible in the valley before them.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Gedeon: Multus tecum est populus, nec tradetur Madian in manus ejus: ne forte glorietur Israël contra me, et dicat: Meis viribus liberatus sum.
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to Gideon, saying: 'The people with you are too numerous. I will not hand Midian over to them, lest Israel boast against me and say: "I was delivered by my own strength."

verses.latin: Loquere ad populum, et cunctis audientibus prædica: Qui timet et est formidolosus, revertatur. Et reversi sunt de monte Galaad viginti duo millia virorum, et remanserunt decem millia.
verses.english: Now, speak to the people and proclaim in everyone's hearing: 'Whoever is fearful and afraid, let him return home.' So, twenty-two thousand men returned from Mount Galaad, and ten thousand remained.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Gedeon: Adhuc populus multus est: duc illos ad aquas, et ibi probabo eos: et de quo dixero tibi ut tecum vadat, ipse vadat: quem vero prohibuero, revertatur.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Gideon: 'There are still too many people. Lead them down to the waters, and there I will test them. Concerning whomever I tell you, "This one shall go with you," that one shall go. But whomever I forbid, that one shall return home.'

verses.latin: Cumque deduxisset eos ad aquas, dixit Dominus ad Gedeon: Qui lingua lambuerint aquas, sicut solent canes lambere, separabis eos seorsum: similiter omnem qui curvatis genibus biberit.
verses.english: When he had led them down to the waters, the Lord said to Gideon: 'All who lap up the waters with their tongues, just as dogs lap, you shall separate them to one side. Likewise, do the same for every one who kneels to drink.'

verses.latin: Fuit itaque numerus eorum qui lambuerunt de manu in os suum, trecenti viri: omnis autem reliqua multitudo curvato poplite biberat.
verses.english: So, the number of those who lapped from their hand to their mouth was three hundred men. However, all the rest of the multitude had knelt on their knees to drink.

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus ad Gedeon: In trecentis viris, qui lambuerunt aquas, liberabo vos, et tradam in manu tua Madian: omnis autem reliqua multitudo revertatur in locum suum.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Gideon: 'With these three hundred men who lapped the waters, I will deliver you and give Midian into your hand. But all the rest of the multitude shall return to their homes.'

verses.latin: Sublatis itaque cibariis, et cuncta armatura reliquorum, omnes Israël redire præcepit ad tabernacula sua: et ipse cum trecentis viris se pugnæ præparabat. Castra autem Madian erant subter in valle.
verses.english: So, Gideon took the provisions and all the armor from the rest of the men. He then ordered all the other Israelites to return to their tents, while he himself, with the three hundred men, prepared for battle. The Midianite camp was below them in the valley.

verses.latin: Eadem nocte dixit Dominus ad eum: Surge, et descende in castra: tradidi enim eos in manu tua.
verses.english: That same night, the Lord said to him: 'Arise and go down into the camp, for I have delivered them into your hand.'

verses.latin: Si autem times solus descendere, descende cum Phara puero tuo.
verses.english: But if you are afraid to go down alone, then go down with Phara, your servant.

verses.latin: Et cum audieris quid loquantur, tunc confortabuntur manus tuæ, et securior ad pugnam descendes. Descendit ergo ipse et Phara puer ejus in partem castrorum, ubi erant armati exploratores.
verses.english: And when you hear what they are saying, then your hands will be strengthened, and you will go down to the battle more confidently. So, he himself and Phara, his servant, went down to the part of the camp where the armed scouts were stationed.

verses.latin: Madian autem, et Amalec, et omnes orientales populi fusi jacebant in valle ut locustarum multitudo: cameli quoque eorum innumerabiles erant sicut arena quæ jacet in littore maris.
verses.english: Now, the Midianites, the Amalekites, and all the peoples from the East were spread out in the valley, as numerous as a swarm of locusts. Their camels were also innumerable, like the sand that lies on the seashore.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset Gedeon, audivit quemdam narrantem socio suo somnium, et inter alia confabulantium, hoc referebat: Somnium vidi, et videbatur mihi quasi subcinericius panis ex hordeo volvi, et in Madian castra descendere: cumque pervenisset ad tabernaculum, percussit illud atque subvertit, et funditus evertit.
verses.english: When Gideon arrived, he heard someone telling a dream to his companion. Among other things they were conversing about, this man recounted: 'I saw a dream. It seemed to me as if a barley loaf of bread was rolling down and came into the camp of Midian. And when it reached a tent, it struck it and overturned it, completely throwing it down.'

verses.latin: Respondit ille cui loquebatur: Non est hoc aliud quam gladius Gedeonis filii Joas viri Israël: et in manus ejus tradidit Dominus Madian et omnia castra ejus.
verses.english: The man to whom he was speaking answered, saying: 'This is nothing other than the sword of Gideon, the son of Joas, a man of Israel! The Lord has delivered Midian and all its camp into his hands.'

verses.latin: Et cum audisset Gedeon somnium, et interpretationem ejus, adoravit: et reversus ad castra Israël, ait: Surgite, surrexerunt enim in manus nostras Dominus castra Madian.
verses.english: And when Gideon had heard the dream and its interpretation, he immediately worshiped God. He then returned to the camp of Israel and said: 'Arise, for the Lord has delivered the camp of Midian into our hands!'

verses.latin: Dividitque trecentos viros in tres partes, et dedit universis tubas in manibus, et hydrias inanes, et lampadas in medio hydriarum.
verses.english: He divided the three hundred men into three companies. To all of them, he gave trumpets in their hands, empty jars, and torches inside the jars.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: Quod me facere videritis, hoc facite: sequimini ducem: et sicut fecero, ita agite.
verses.english: And he said to them: 'Whatever you see me do, that is what you are to do. Follow your leader. Act exactly as I act.'

verses.latin: Quando clangam buccina, et vos per circuitum castrorum. Et dicetis: Domini et Gedeonis.
verses.english: When I blow the trumpet, then you also, all around the camp, are to blow. And you are to say: 'The Lord's and Gideon's!'

verses.latin: Ingressus est itaque Gedeon et trecenti viri qui erant cum eo, in partem castrorum post mediam noctis horam, excubiasque primas justos posuerant: et clangerunt buccinis, contrivissentque hydrias inter se.
verses.english: So, Gideon and the three hundred men who were with him entered the part of the camp just after the middle watch of the night, right after the first guards had been stationed. They blew their trumpets and broke the jars they held among themselves.

verses.latin: Cumque in tribus locis sonuissent tubæ, et hydriæ confractæ essent, tenuerunt ad lævam lampadas, et ad dexteram tubas, clamantes: Gladius Domini et Gedeonis.
verses.english: When the trumpets had sounded in the three places, and the jars were broken, they held the torches in their left hands and the trumpets in their right hands, shouting: 'The sword of the Lord and of Gideon!'

verses.latin: Stetit unusquisque in loco suo per circuitum castrorum Madian: omnesque castrorum perturbati, atque vociferantes, fugerunt.
verses.english: Every man stood in his place all around the camp of Midian. All those in the camp were thrown into confusion, shouting and fleeing in terror.

verses.latin: Et cum trecentis viris buccinis tantum clangentibus, convertit Dominus omnium in semetipsos gladios, et mutua cæde truncabantur. Fugientesque usque ad Bethsetta, et finem Abelmehula in Tebbath.
verses.english: And with only the three hundred men sounding their trumpets, the Lord turned every man's sword against his fellow, and they were slaughtered by mutual killing. They fled as far as Beth-shettah, and to the edge of Abel-meholah, near Tabbath.

verses.latin: Conclamantibus autem Israël de Nephthali et Aser, et omni Manasse, persequebantur Madian.
verses.english: Then, Israel, with men from Naphtali, Asher, and all Manasseh, were called out and pursued Midian.

verses.latin: Misitque Gedeon nuncios in omnem montem Ephraim, dicens: Descendite in occursum Madian, et occupate aquarum cursus usque Bethbera atque Jordanem. Conclamatus est itaque omnis Ephraim, et occupavit aquarum cursus usque Bethbera et Jordanem.
verses.english: And Gideon sent messengers throughout all the hill country of Ephraim, saying: 'Come down to meet Midian and seize the water crossings as far as Beth-barah and the Jordan River.' So, all of Ephraim was called out, and they seized the water crossings as far as Beth-barah and the Jordan.

verses.latin: Apprehensosque duos viros Madian, Oreb et Zeb, interfecit Oreb in petra Oreb, Zeb vero in torculari Zeb. Et cum instarent ei de Madian, abstulerunt capita Oreb et Zeb, et attulerunt ad Gedeon trans Jordanem.
verses.english: They captured two Midianite leaders, Oreb and Zeb. They killed Oreb at the Rock of Oreb, and Zeb at the Winepress of Zeb. And while they pressed Gideon from Midian, they cut off the heads of Oreb and Zeb and brought them to Gideon across the Jordan.

verses.latin: Igitur Ierobbaal, qui est Gedeon, surrexit diluculo, et omnis multitudo cum eo: et castra metati sunt juxta fontem Harad. Castra autem Madian erant ab aquilone, juxta vallem illustrem.
verses.english: So Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, rose very early, and his entire army with him. They set up their camp near the spring of Harod. The Midianite camp, by contrast, was to the north, in the valley known for its prominence.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Gedeon: Multa tecum est turba, nec tradetur Madian in manus ejus, ne forte glorietur Israel contra me, et dicat: Meis viribus liberatus sum.
verses.english: The Lord then said to Gideon, "You have too many men with you. I will not hand the Midianites over to such a large army, because if I did, the people of Israel might boast against me, saying, 'We saved ourselves by our own strength!'"

verses.latin: Loquere ad populum, et cunctis audientibus praedica: Qui timet et formidat, revertatur. Et reversi sunt de monte Galaad viginti duo millia virorum, et tantum decem millia remanserunt.
verses.english: "Therefore, speak to the people and make this declaration for everyone to hear: 'Whoever is fearful and afraid, let him turn back now.'" So, twenty-two thousand men returned from Mount Gilead, leaving only ten thousand behind.

verses.latin: Et rursum dixit Dominus ad Gedeon: Adhuc turba est nimia: duc eos ad aquas, et ibi probabo illos, atque de quibus dixero tibi ut tecum vadant, ipsi pergent: quos vero ire prohibuero, revertentur.
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Gideon again, saying, "There are still too many men. Lead them down to the water, and I will test them for you there. Those about whom I tell you, 'This one shall go with you,' shall go. But everyone about whom I tell you, 'This one shall not go,' shall return."

verses.latin: Cumque deduxisset eos ad aquas, dixit Dominus ad Gedeon: Qui lambuerint aquas lingua, sicut solent canes lambere, separabis eos seorsum: qui autem curvatis genibus biberint, in alteram partem erunt.
verses.english: So when Gideon led the men down to the water, the Lord said to him, "Everyone who laps the water with his tongue, like a dog laps, you shall set aside by himself. Also, set aside everyone who kneels down to drink."

verses.latin: Fuit itaque numerus eorum qui manu ad os procurrentes lambuerant aquas, trecenti viri: omnis autem reliqua multitudo flexo poplite biberat.
verses.english: The number of men who lapped the water by bringing it to their mouths with their hands was three hundred. All the remaining men in the army drank by kneeling down.

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus ad Gedeon: In trecentis viris qui lambuerunt aquas, liberabo vos, et tradam Madian in manu tua: omnis autem reliqua turba revertatur in loca sua.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Gideon, "With these three hundred men who lapped the water, I will save you and deliver the Midianites into your hand. Let all the rest of the army return to their own homes."

verses.latin: Sublatis igitur pro victu populi et phialis, omnes reliquos Israel redire praecepit in tabernacula sua: et ipse cum trecentis viris bellum parabat. Castra autem Madian erant subter in valle.
verses.english: So Gideon took the provisions for the remaining people, as well as their trumpets, and sent all the rest of the Israelites back to their tents. Gideon himself, with only the three hundred men, prepared for battle. The Midianite camp was situated below them in the valley.

verses.latin: Eadem nocte dixit Dominus ad eum: Surge, et descende in castra: tradidi enim eos in manu tua.
verses.english: That very night, the Lord said to Gideon, "Get up! Go down into the enemy camp, for I have already delivered them into your hands."

verses.latin: Si autem times solus descendere, descende cum Phara puero tuo.
verses.english: "However, if you are afraid to go down by yourself, then go down with your servant, Pharah."

verses.latin: Et cum audieris quid loquantur, tunc confortabuntur manus tuae, et securior ad pugnam perges. Descendit ergo ipse et Phara puer ejus in partem castrorum in qua erant armati.
verses.english: "And when you hear what they are saying, then your hands will be strengthened, and you will go into battle with more confidence." So Gideon and his servant Pharah went down to the edge of the camp where the armed guards were positioned.

verses.latin: Madian autem et Amalec, et omnes orientales populi, diffusi jacebant in valle, quasi locustarum multitudo: cameli quoque innumerabiles erant, sicut arena quae est in littore maris.
verses.english: The Midianites, the Amalekites, and all the peoples from the East were spread out across the valley, as numerous as a swarm of locusts. Their camels were likewise countless, like the grains of sand on the seashore.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset Gedeon, audivit quemdam narrantem proximo suo somnium, et inter cetera sic loquentem: Somnium vidi, et ecce panis subcinericius ex hordeo subvertit tentorium Madian ab imis, et suffodit illud, ac solo tenus evertit.
verses.english: When Gideon reached the camp, he heard one man telling his neighbor a dream. The man was saying, "I had a dream, and behold, a humble loaf of barley bread came tumbling into the Midianite camp, struck a tent, and completely overturned it to the ground!"

verses.latin: Respondit ille cui loquebatur: Nihil aliud est hic somnus, nisi gladius Gedeonis filii Joas viri Israelitae: et in manu ejus tradidit Dominus Madian, et omnia castra ejus.
verses.english: The man he was speaking to replied, "This dream can mean nothing other than the sword of Gideon, the son of Joash, an Israelite man! God the Lord has delivered Midian and their entire army into his hands."

verses.latin: Cumque audisset Gedeon somnium et interpretationem ejus, adoravit: et reversus ad castra Israel, ait: Surgite, tradidit enim Dominus in manus nostras castra Madian.
verses.english: When Gideon heard the dream and its interpretation, he immediately worshipped God. He then returned to the camp of Israel and said, "Arise! For the Lord has delivered the Midianite camp into our hands!"

verses.latin: Et divisit trecentos viros in tres partes, et dedit universis tubas in manibus, et hydrias vacuas, et lampades in medio hydriarum.
verses.english: Gideon divided the three hundred men into three separate companies. He gave each man a trumpet, an empty pitcher, and a torch to be hidden inside the pitcher.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: Quod me videritis facere, hoc facite: ingrediar partem castrorum, et quodcumque fecero, imitaminis.
verses.english: And he said to them, "Watch me carefully, and do exactly as I do. When I go to the edge of the enemy camp, whatever I do there, you must imitate."

verses.latin: Quando intonuerit bucina mea, et omnium qui mecum sunt, vos quoque per circuitum castrorum clangite, et conclamate: Domini et Gedeonis gladius.
verses.english: "When my trumpet sounds, along with the trumpets of everyone with me, then you also, all around the camp, must blow your trumpets and shout, 'A sword for the Lord and for Gideon!'"

verses.latin: Ingressus est itaque Gedeon, et trecenti viri qui cum eo erant, in castra hostium, prima vigiliae noctis, et confestim, succensis tubis, et hydriis fractis,
verses.english: So Gideon and the three hundred men with him entered the enemy camp just as the middle watch of the night was beginning, right after the guards had been posted. Immediately, they blew their trumpets and smashed the pitchers, revealing the bright torches.

verses.latin: clamarunt, Domini et Gedeonis gladius:
verses.english: and they all cried out, "A sword for the Lord and for Gideon!"

verses.latin: stantes singuli in loco suo, circum castra hostium, et omnes hostes perterriti, ululantes atque fugientes,
verses.english: Each man stood in his position surrounding the enemy camp. All the Midianite soldiers were utterly terrified, crying out and fleeing in confusion.

verses.latin: trecentis viris tubis tantum clangentibus, et gladiis se invicem percutientes, et mutuis confodientes vulneribus.
verses.english: As the three hundred men kept blowing their trumpets, the Lord caused all the Midianite soldiers in the camp to turn their swords against one another and strike each other down with mutual wounds.

verses.latin: Convocati autem viri Israel de Nephtali et Aser, et omni Manasse, persecuti sunt Madian.
verses.english: Then, the men of Israel from Naphtali, Asher, and all of Manasseh, who had previously been sent home, were called to gather and pursue the fleeing Midianites.

verses.latin: Misitque Gedeon nuncios in omnem montem Ephraim, dicens: Descendite in occursum Madian, et occupate aquarum cursus usque Bethbera et Jordanem. Clamor itaque omnis viri Ephraim, et aquarum, ac Jordanis.
verses.english: Gideon also sent messengers throughout all the hill country of Ephraim, saying, "Come down to intercept the Midianites and seize the water crossings as far as Beth-barah and the Jordan River!" So, all the men of Ephraim gathered together with a great cry and secured the water crossings of the Jordan.

verses.latin: Comprehensosque duos viros Madian, Oreb et Zeb, interfecit Oreb in petra Oreb, et Zeb in torculari Zeb. Et persecuti sunt Madian, capita Oreb et Zeb deferentes ad Gedeon trans Jordanem.
verses.english: They captured two Midianite chiefs, Oreb and Zeb. They killed Oreb at the Rock of Oreb and Zeb at the Winepress of Zeb. Then, continuing their pursuit of the Midianites, they brought the severed heads of Oreb and Zeb to Gideon, who was waiting beyond the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ad eum viri Ephraim: Quae est haec res quam facere voluisti, ut nos non vocares cum ad pugnam pergeres contra Madian? Et jurgabant eum valide.
verses.english: Then the men of Ephraim came to Gideon, very angry. They demanded of him, "What is this action you have taken? You did not call us to come with you when you went to fight against Midian!" They strongly argued with him and criticized him.

verses.latin: Quibus ille respondit: Quid facere potui tale quale vos fecistis? Nonne melior est botrus Ephraim vindemiis Abiezer?
verses.english: Gideon responded to them: "What have I done that could compare to what you have accomplished? Is not the gleaning done by Ephraim better than the full harvest of Abiezer?"

verses.latin: In manus vestras tradidit Deus principes Madian, Oreb et Zeb: quid tale facere potui quale vos fecistis? Postquam locutus est verbum hoc, requievit spiritus eorum adversus eum.
verses.english: God Himself delivered the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeb, into your hands! How could anything I have done compare to that great deed of yours? After Gideon spoke this, their anger towards him subsided.

verses.latin: Venitque Gedeon ad Jordanem, et transivit ipse, et trecenti viri, qui secum erant, fessi et insequentes.
verses.english: Gideon then reached the Jordan River and crossed it, along with the three hundred men who were with him. They were all exhausted but still in pursuit of the enemy.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad viros Soccoth: Date, obsecro, panes populo qui mecum est, quia defessi sunt, ut possimus fugientes persequi Zebee et Salmana reges Madian.
verses.english: He said to the men of Succoth: "Please give bread to the people who are with me, because they are weary. This way we can continue to pursue Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian, who are still fleeing."

verses.latin: Responderuntque principes Soccoth: Numquid palma manus Zebee et Salmana in manu tua est, ut demus exercitui tuo panes?
verses.english: But the officials of Succoth replied: "Do you already have the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna in your power? Are they already captured? How can we give food to your army now?"

verses.latin: Et ait Gedeon: Idcirco cum tradiderit Dominus Zebee et Salmana in manus meas, conteram carnes vestras cum spinis et tribulis deserti.
verses.english: Gideon answered: "Because of this, when the Lord delivers Zebah and Zalmunna into my hands, I will crush your flesh with thorns and thistles from the wilderness."

verses.latin: Et inde conscendens, venit in Phanuel: locutusque est ad eos similia. Cui et illi responderunt sicut responderant viri Soccoth.
verses.english: From there, he went up to Penuel and spoke to its men in the same manner. The men of Penuel also gave him the same reply as the men of Succoth.

verses.latin: Dixitque et illis: Cum reversus fuero victor, destruam turrim istam.
verses.english: So Gideon told them as well: "When I return victorious, I will tear down this tower of yours."

verses.latin: Zebee autem et Salmana quiescebant cum omni exercitu suo, quindecim millia virorum, qui remanserant ex omnibus castris Midianitarum, et centum viginti millia pugnatorum, qui fuerant caesi.
verses.english: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were resting with their entire army, which numbered fifteen thousand men. These were all that remained from the vast camp of the Midianites, as one hundred twenty thousand warriors had already been killed.

verses.latin: Ascenditque Gedeon per viam eorum qui tendebant in tabernaculis, ad orientalem partem Nobe et Jegbaa, et percussit castra hostium, qui securi erant.
verses.english: Gideon went up by the route of the tent-dwellers, to the east of Nobah and Jogbehah. He struck the enemy camp when they felt secure and unsuspecting.

verses.latin: Fugeruntque Zebee et Salmana, quos persequens Gedeon comprehendit, turbato omni exercitu eorum.
verses.english: Zebah and Zalmunna fled, but Gideon pursued them and captured them, having thrown their entire army into a panic.

verses.latin: Reversusque Gedeon de pugna, ante solis ortum,
verses.english: As Gideon returned from the battle, before sunrise,

verses.latin: apprehendit puerum de viris Soccoth: et interrogavit eum nomina principum et seniorum Soccoth, et scripsit septuaginta septem viros.
verses.english: he seized a young man from the men of Succoth. He questioned him, asking for the names of the leaders and elders of Succoth, and the young man wrote down seventy-seven men.

verses.latin: Venitque ad viros Soccoth, et dixit: En Zebee et Salmana, super quibus exprobravistis mihi, dicentes: Numquid manus Zebee et Salmana in manu tua est, ut demus viris tuis defessis panes?
verses.english: Then Gideon went to the men of Succoth and said: "Here are Zebah and Zalmunna! These are the men concerning whom you mocked me, saying: 'Is the hand of Zebah and Zalmunna already in your grasp, that we should give bread to your weary men?'"

verses.latin: Tulit ergo seniores civitatis, et spinas deserti ac tribulos: et contrivit cum eis, atque comminuit viros Soccoth.
verses.english: So Gideon took the elders of the city, along with thorns and thistles from the wilderness. With these, he punished and taught the men of Succoth a painful lesson.

verses.latin: Turrim quoque Phanuel subvertit, occisis habitatoribus civitatis.
verses.english: He also tore down the tower of Penuel and killed the inhabitants of that city.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Zebee et Salmana: Quales fuerunt viri quos occidistis in Thabor? Qui responderunt: Similes tui, et unusquisque quasi filius regis.
verses.english: Then Gideon asked Zebah and Zalmunna: "What kind of men were those whom you killed at Tabor?" They replied: "They were like you, each one appearing as a king's son."

verses.latin: Quibus ille ait: Filii mei, fratres mei fuerunt, quos interfecistis: vivo Domino, si salvassetis eos, non vos occiderem.
verses.english: Gideon said to them: "They were my sons, my own brothers, whom you murdered! As the Lord lives, if you had spared their lives, I would not kill you now."

verses.latin: Et conversus ad Jether primogenitum suum: Surge, et interfice eos. Qui non eduxit gladium: timebat enim, quia adhuc puer erat.
verses.english: Then he turned to Jether, his firstborn son, and said: "Arise, and kill them!" But Jether did not draw his sword, because he was afraid, for he was still a mere boy.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque Zebee et Salmana: Surge tu, et interfice nos: quia juxta aetatem est fortitudo viri. Surrexit Gedeon, et interfecit Zebee et Salmana: et tulit ornamenta de collis camelorum eorum.
verses.english: Zebah and Zalmunna then said to Gideon: "You yourself, arise and kill us. For a man's strength is according to his age." So Gideon rose and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the ornaments from the necks of their camels.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque omnes viri Israel ad Gedeon: Dominare nostri tu, et filius tuus, et filius filii tui: quia liberasti nos de manu Madian.
verses.english: Then all the men of Israel said to Gideon: "Rule over us, you and your son and your grandson, because you have delivered us from the hand of Midian."

verses.latin: Quibus ille ait: Non dominabor vestri, nec dominabitur in vos filius meus, sed Dominus dominabitur vestri.
verses.english: But Gideon said to them: "I will not rule over you, nor will my son rule over you. The Lord alone will rule over you."

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eos: Unam petitionem postulo a vobis: date mihi inaures ex praeda vestra. Inaures enim aureas Ismahelitae habere consueverant.
verses.english: And Gideon said to them: "I have one request to make of you. Give me the earrings from your plunder." (For the Ishmaelites, who were the Midianites, were accustomed to wearing golden earrings.)

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: Libentissime dabimus. Extendentesque pallium, posuerunt in eo inaures de praeda.
verses.english: They replied: "We will gladly give them!" So they spread out a cloak, and each man threw into it the earrings from his plunder.

verses.latin: Fuitque pondus aurearum inaurium, quas postulaverat, mille septingenti sicli aurei, absque ornamentis, et monilibus, atque purpura quibus reges Madian uti soliti fuerant, et torquibus camelorum.
verses.english: The weight of the golden earrings that Gideon had requested was seventeen hundred shekels of gold. This was besides the ornate crescents, pendants, and purple garments that the kings of Midian usually wore, and also the chains from the camels' necks.

verses.latin: Fecitque ex eo Gedeon ephod, et posuit illud in civitate sua Ephra. Fornicatusque est omnis Israel in eo ibi: et factum est Gedeoni et omni domui ejus in ruinam.
verses.english: Gideon made an ephod from this gold and placed it in his city, Ophrah. All of Israel committed spiritual adultery by worshiping it there, and it became a snare and ruin for Gideon and his entire household.

verses.latin: Humiliatus est autem Madian coram filiis Israel, nec potuerunt ultra caput elevare: sed quievit terra quadraginta annis, quibus Gedeon praefuit.
verses.english: So Midian was humbled before the sons of Israel and could no longer lift their heads in pride. The land enjoyed peace for forty years, throughout the time Gideon governed them.

verses.latin: Abiit itaque Jerobaal filius Joas, et habitavit in domo sua.
verses.english: Then Jerubbaal, who was Gideon the son of Joash, went and lived in his own house.

verses.latin: Habuitque septuaginta filios, qui egressi sunt de femore ejus: tot enim uxores habebat.
verses.english: Gideon had seventy sons, who were his direct offspring, for he had many wives.

verses.latin: Et concubina ejus, quam habebat in Sichem, peperit ei filium, nomine Abimelech.
verses.english: His concubine, whom he kept in Shechem, also bore him a son, whose name was Abimelech.

verses.latin: Mortuusque est Gedeon filius Joas in aetate bona: et sepultus est in sepulchro Joas patris sui in Ephra de familia Eze.
verses.english: Gideon, the son of Joash, died at a good old age. He was buried in the tomb of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the family of the Abiezrites.

verses.latin: Postquam autem mortuus est Gedeon, aversi sunt filii Israel, et fornicati sunt cum Baalim: percusseruntque sibi pactum cum Baalberith, ut ipsum colerent.
verses.english: After Gideon died, the sons of Israel turned away from God and committed spiritual adultery with the Baals. They established a covenant with Baal-berith, promising to worship him as their god.

verses.latin: Nec sunt recordati Domini Dei sui, qui eruerat eos de manu omnium inimicorum suorum per circuitum:
verses.english: They did not remember the Lord their God, who had delivered them from the hand of all their surrounding enemies.

verses.latin: neque fecerunt misericordiam cum domo Jerobaal Gedeon juxta omnia bona quae fecerat.
verses.english: Nor did they show kindness to the household of Jerubbaal, that is, Gideon, in return for all the good he had done for Israel.

verses.latin: Viri autem Ephraim dixerunt ad Gedeon: Quid est hoc, quod facere voluisti, ut non nos vocares, cum ad pugnam pergeres contra Madian? Et jurgabant eum valide.
verses.english: The men of Ephraim said to Gideon, "What is this thing you have done? You did not call us when you went out to fight against Midian." And they argued with him very vehemently because of this.

verses.latin: Quibus ille respondit: Quid facere potui tale, quale vos fecistis? Nonne melior est botrus Ephraim vindemiis Abiezer?
verses.english: To them, he replied, "What could I have done that was like what you have done? Is not the gleaning of Ephraim better than the full harvest of Abiezer?"

verses.latin: In manus vestras tradidit Deus principes Madian Oreb et Zeb: quid tale facere potui, quale vos fecistis? Cumque locutus esset verba hæc, quievit spiritus eorum, quo tumebant.
verses.english: God has delivered into your hands the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeb. What could I have done that was like what you have accomplished? When he had spoken these words, their anger, with which they had been swelling, subsided.

verses.latin: Venitque Gedeon ad Jordanem, et transivit ipse, et trecenti viri, qui erant cum eo, fessi et esurientes.
verses.english: Gideon then came to the Jordan River, and he crossed over, along with the three hundred men who were with him. They were exhausted and hungry.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad viros Soccoth: Date, obsecro, panes populo, qui mecum est, quia defecerunt, et vehementer esuriunt: et persequor Zebee et Salmana reges Madian.
verses.english: And he said to the men of Succoth, "Please give bread to the people who are with me, because they are faint and extremely hungry. I am pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian."

verses.latin: Responderuntque principes Soccoth: Numquid in manu tua sunt manibus Zebee et Salmana, ut demus exercitui tuo panes?
verses.english: The princes of Succoth replied, "Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in your power, that we should give bread to your army?"

verses.latin: Et ait Gedeon: Idcirco cum tradiderit Dominus Zebee et Salmana in manus meas, conteram carnes vestras cum spinis et tribulis deserti.
verses.english: Gideon said, "Because of this, when the Lord has delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hands, I will tear your flesh with the thorns and thistles of the wilderness."

verses.latin: Ascendit quoque inde in Phanuel, et locutus est ad eos similia. Responderuntque ei viri Phanuel, sicut responderant ei viri Soccoth.
verses.english: From there, he also went up to Penuel and spoke to them in a similar way. The men of Penuel responded to him just as the men of Succoth had replied.

verses.latin: Dixitque et eis: Cum reversus fuero victor, destruam turrim istam.
verses.english: And he also said to them, "When I return victorious, I will destroy this tower."

verses.latin: Zebee autem et Salmana quiescebant cum omni exercitu suo, quindecim millia virorum omnes, qui remanserant de cunctis campestribus orientis: cæsi quippe fuerant centum viginti millia virorum bellatorum.
verses.english: Zebah and Zalmunna, however, were resting with their entire army, all fifteen thousand men who remained of all the eastern forces. Indeed, one hundred twenty thousand fighting men had already been slain.

verses.latin: Ascenditque Gedeon per viam eorum, qui tendebant in tabernaculis, ad orientalem partem Nobe et Jegbaa, et percussit castra hostium, qui securi erant.
verses.english: And Gideon went up by the way of those who lived in tents, on the east side of Nobah and Jogbehah, and he struck the enemy's camp, because they felt secure.

verses.latin: Fugeruntque Zebee et Salmana, quos persequens Gedeon comprehendit, turbatoque omni exercitu eorum.
verses.english: Zebah and Zalmunna fled, and Gideon pursued them and captured them, throwing their entire army into confusion.

verses.latin: Reversusque est Gedeon de pugna ante solis ortum,
verses.english: Gideon returned from the battle before the sun rose.

verses.latin: apprehendens puerum de viris Soccoth: interrogavitque eum nomina principum et seniorum Soccoth, et scripsit septuaginta septem viros.
verses.english: He seized a young man from the men of Succoth and questioned him about the names of the princes and elders of Succoth. The young man wrote down seventy-seven men.

verses.latin: Venitque ad viros Soccoth, et dixit: En Zebee et Salmana, de quibus exprobravistis mihi, dicentes: Numquid in manu tua sunt manibus Zebee et Salmana, ut demus viris tuis fessis panes?
verses.english: Then he came to the men of Succoth and said, "Here are Zebah and Zalmunna, about whom you taunted me, saying, 'Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in your power, that we should give bread to your weary men?'"

verses.latin: Tulitque seniores civitatis, et spinas deserti ac tribulos, et contrivit cum eis atque comminuit viros Soccoth.
verses.english: So he took the elders of the city, and the thorns and thistles of the wilderness, and with them, he threshed and crushed the men of Succoth.

verses.latin: Turrim quoque Phanuel subvertit, occisis habitatoribus ejus.
verses.english: He also pulled down the tower of Penuel, killing its inhabitants.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Zebee et Salmana: Quales erant viri, quos occidistis in Thabor? Qui responderunt: Similes tui, et unusquisque quasi filius regis.
verses.english: And he said to Zebah and Zalmunna, "What kind of men were those whom you killed at Tabor?" They replied, "They were like you, each one appearing like a son of a king."

verses.latin: Quibus ille ait: Fratres mei fuerunt, filii matris meæ: vivit Dominus, quia si servassetis eos, non vos occiderem.
verses.english: To them, he said, "They were my brothers, the sons of my mother. As the Lord lives, if you had spared them, I would not kill you now."

verses.latin: Dixitque Jether primogenito suo: Surge, et interfice eos. Qui non eduxit gladium, timens, quia adhuc puer erat.
verses.english: Then he said to Jether, his firstborn son, "Rise and kill them." But he did not draw his sword, because he was afraid, for he was still a boy.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt Zebee et Salmana: Surge tu, et interfice nos: quia juxta ætatem robur est viri. Surrexitque Gedeon, et interfecit Zebee et Salmana: et tulit ornamenta, et torques aureos camelorum.
verses.english: Zebah and Zalmunna said, "Rise yourself and kill us, for a man's strength is according to his age." So Gideon rose and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the ornaments and the golden chains from their camels.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque omnes viri Israël ad Gedeon: Dominare nostri tu, et filius tuus, et filius filii tui: quia liberasti nos de manu Madian.
verses.english: Then all the men of Israel said to Gideon, "Rule over us, you, and your son, and your grandson, because you have delivered us from the hand of Midian."

verses.latin: Quibus ille ait: Non dominabor vestri, nec dominabitur in vos filius meus, sed Dominus dominabitur vestri.
verses.english: To them, he said, "I will not rule over you, nor will my son rule over you. The Lord alone will rule over you."

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eos: Unam petitionem postulo a vobis: date mihi inaures ex præda vestra. Inaures aureas habebant Ismælitæ.
verses.english: And he said to them, "I have one request to ask of you: give me the earrings from your plunder." For the Ishmaelites had golden earrings.

verses.latin: Qui responderunt: Libenter dabimus. Extendentesque sagulum, posuerunt in eo inaures, quas quisque capere potuerat.
verses.english: They replied, "We will gladly give them." Spreading out a cloak, they each threw into it the earrings they had been able to seize.

verses.latin: Fuit autem pondus inaurium aurearum, quas postularat, mille septingenti auri sicli, absque ornamentis, et monilibus, et purpura vestium, quibus reges Madian induti fuerant, et torquibus camelorum.
verses.english: The weight of the golden earrings that he had requested was one thousand seven hundred shekels of gold, besides the ornaments, necklaces, and the purple garments that the kings of Midian had worn, and the chains from the camels.

verses.latin: Fecitque ex eo Gedeon ephod, et posuit illud in civitate sua Ephra, fornicatusque est omnis Israël post id: et factum est Gedeoni et omni domui ejus in ruinam.
verses.english: Gideon made an ephod from it and placed it in his city, Ophrah. And all of Israel prostituted themselves after it—worshipping this idol—and it became a ruin for Gideon and for all his house.

verses.latin: Humiliatus est autem Madian coram filiis Israël, nec potuerunt ultra caput elevare: sed quievit terra quadraginta annis, quo tempore præfuit Gedeon.
verses.english: So Midian was humbled before the sons of Israel, and they could not lift up their heads any longer. And the land had rest for forty years, during the time Gideon ruled.

verses.latin: Abiit itaque Jerobaal filius Joas, et habitavit in domo sua.
verses.english: So Jerubbaal, the son of Joash, went and lived in his own house.

verses.latin: Habuitque septuaginta filios ex lumbis suis, qui egressi fuerant: tot enim uxores habuit.
verses.english: He had seventy sons who were born from his own body, for he had many wives.

verses.latin: Et concubina ejus, quam habebat in Sichem, peperit ei filium, nomine Abimelech.
verses.english: And his concubine, whom he had in Shechem, bore him a son named Abimelech.

verses.latin: Mortuusque est Gedeon filius Joas in senectute bona, et sepultus est in sepulchro Joas patris sui in Ephra de familia Ezeu.
verses.english: Gideon, the son of Joash, died in a good old age and was buried in the tomb of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the family of Abiezrites.

verses.latin: Postquam autem mortuus est Gedeon, aversi sunt filii Israël, et fornicati sunt post Baalim: posueruntque sibi Baalberith ut deum.
verses.english: After Gideon died, the sons of Israel turned away and prostituted themselves after the Baals. They set up Baal-Berith as their god.

verses.latin: Nec sunt recordati Domini Dei sui, qui eruerat eos de manu omnium inimicorum suorum per circuitum:
verses.english: They did not remember the Lord their God, who had delivered them from the hand of all their enemies all around them.

verses.latin: neque fecerunt misericordiam cum domo Jerobaal Gedeon juxta omnia bona, quæ fecerat.
verses.english: Nor did they show kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, that is, Gideon, in return for all the good that he had done for them.

verses.latin: Eo tempore abiit Abimelech filius Jerobaal ad Sichem, ad fratres matris suæ, et locutus est ad eos, et ad omnem cognationem domus patris matris suæ, dicens:
verses.english: At that time, Abimelech, the son of Jerubbaal, went to Shechem, to the brothers of his mother, and spoke to them and to all the relatives of his mother's family, saying:

verses.latin: Quid vobis est melius, ut dominentur vestri septuaginta viri, omnes filii Jerobaal, an ut dominetur vobis unus vir? simul considerate quia os vestrum et caro vestra sum.
verses.english: "Which is better for you: that seventy men, all the sons of Jerubbaal, rule over you, or that one man rule over you? Consider also that I am your bone and your flesh."

verses.latin: Locutique sunt fratres matris ejus de eo cunctis viris Sichem universos sermones istos, et inclinaverunt corda eorum in Abimelech, dicentes: Frater noster est.
verses.english: The brothers of his mother spoke concerning him all these words to all the men of Shechem, and they inclined their hearts toward Abimelech, saying, "He is our brother."

verses.latin: Preberuntque illi septuaginta argenti siclos de templo Baalberith: qui dedit eos viris inopes et cursantibus, et secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: They gave him seventy shekels of silver from the temple of Baal-Berith. With this money, he hired worthless and reckless men, and they followed him.

verses.latin: Venitque in domum patris sui Ephra, et occidit fratres suos filios Jerobaal, septuaginta viros super unum lapidem: mansitque deinceps Joatham filius Jerobaal minimus, quia absconderat se.
verses.english: Then he came to his father's house in Ophrah and killed his brothers, the sons of Jerubbaal—seventy men—on one stone. Only Jotham, the youngest son of Jerubbaal, remained alive, because he had hidden himself.

verses.latin: Abiit autem Abimelech filius Jerobaal in Sichem ad fratres matris suæ, et locutus est ad eos et ad omnem cognationem patris matris suæ, dicens:
verses.english: Abimelech, who was the son of Jerubaal, went to Shechem, to his mother’s brothers. He spoke to them and to all the family of his mother’s father, saying:

verses.latin: Loquimini, inquam, et audite in auribus virorum Sichem: Quid vobis est melius, ut dominentur vobis septuaginta viri, omnes filii Jerobaal, an ut dominetur vobis unus vir? Addite et hoc, quia frater vester sum.
verses.english: “Tell the men of Shechem to listen carefully to what I say: Which is better for you—that seventy men rule over you, all the sons of Jerubaal, or that one man rule over you? Also, remind them that I am your own flesh and blood, your brother.”

verses.latin: Locutique sunt fratres matris ejus de eo cunctis viris Sichem universos sermones istos, et inclinaverunt corda eorum in Abimelech, dicentes: Frater noster est.
verses.english: His mother’s brothers then spoke all these words about Abimelech to all the men of Shechem. And the hearts of the men of Shechem were inclined toward Abimelech, for they said, “He is our brother, after all.”

verses.latin: Dederuntque illi septuaginta pondo argenti de templo Baalberith: qui conduxit sibi ex eo viros inopes et vagos, et secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: And so they gave him seventy pieces of silver from the temple of Baal-Berith. With this silver, Abimelech hired worthless and wandering men, and they followed him.

verses.latin: Et venit in domum patris sui in Ephra, et occidit fratres suos filios Jerobaal, septuaginta viros, super unum lapidem: mansitque Joatham filius Jerobaal minimus, et absconditus est.
verses.english: Abimelech then went to his father’s house in Ophrah. There, on a single stone, he killed his brothers, the seventy sons of Jerubaal. Only Jotham, Jerubaal’s youngest son, remained alive because he had hidden himself.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt ergo omnes viri Sichem, et universæ familiæ urbis Mello: et abierunt atque constituerunt Abimelech regem, juxta quercum quæ steterat in Sichem.
verses.english: So all the men of Shechem and all the families of the city of Millo gathered together. They went and made Abimelech king beside the oak tree that stood in Shechem.

verses.latin: Quod cum nuntiatum esset Joatham, ivit et stetit in vertice montis Garizim: et elevata voce clamavit, et dixit: Audite me, viri Sichem, sic audiat vos Deus.
verses.english: When this was told to Jotham, he went and stood on the top of Mount Gerizim. He raised his voice and cried out, saying, “Listen to me, you men of Shechem, and may God listen to you!”

verses.latin: Ierunt ligna ut ungerent super se regem: dixeruntque olivæ: Impera nobis.
verses.english: “Once, the trees went out to anoint a king over themselves. They said to the olive tree: ‘Rule over us.’

verses.latin: Quæ respondit: Numquid possum unctionem meam dimittere, qua et dii utuntur et homines, et inter ligna promoveri?
verses.english: But the olive tree answered: ‘Can I give up my oil, by which both God and men are honored, and go to wave over the other trees?’

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ligna ad ficum: Veni, et impera nobis.
verses.english: Then the trees said to the fig tree: ‘Come, you, and rule over us.’

verses.latin: Quæ respondit eis: Numquid possum deserere dulcedinem meam et fructus meos optimos, et ire inter cætera ligna?
verses.english: But the fig tree answered them: ‘Can I give up my sweetness and my excellent fruit, and go to wave over the other trees?’

verses.latin: Et locuta sunt ligna ad vitem: Veni, et impera nobis.
verses.english: Then the trees spoke to the vine: ‘Come, and rule over us.’

verses.latin: Quæ respondit: Numquid possum dimittere vinum meum, quod lætificat Deum et homines, et inter cuncta ligna versari?
verses.english: But the vine answered: ‘Can I give up my wine, which gladdens both God and men, and go to wave over the other trees?’

verses.latin: Dixeruntque omnia ligna ad rhamnum: Veni, et impera nobis.
verses.english: Then all the trees said to the bramble: ‘Come, and rule over us.’

verses.latin: Cujus respondens rhamnus: Si revera, inquit, me regem vobis ungetis, venite et sub umbra mea requiescite: sin autem non vultis, egrediatur ignis de rhamno, et devoret cedros Libani.
verses.english: And the bramble answered them: ‘If you truly wish to anoint me as your king, then come and rest in my shadow. But if not, then let fire come out from the bramble and consume the cedars of Lebanon.’

verses.latin: Nunc igitur, si opere et veritate fecistis, et bonum opus reddidistis Jerobaal et domui ejus, et retributionem congruam injuriarum, quæ illi ab eo sunt illatæ,
verses.english: “Now then, if you have acted with sincerity and truth, and have dealt well with Jerubaal and his household, and have given him a fitting reward for the injuries he endured from you —

verses.latin: qui pugnavit pro vobis, et animam suam tradidit periculis, ut erueret vos de manu Madian,
verses.english: he who fought for you, who put his life in danger to deliver you from the hand of Midian —

verses.latin: et vos hodie surrexistis contra domum patris mei, et interfecistis filios ejus septuaginta viros super unum lapidem, et constituistis Abimelech filium ancillæ ejus super viros Sichem regem, eo quod frater vester sit:
verses.english: and yet you have risen up today against my father’s household, and have killed his seventy sons upon one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his maidservant, king over the men of Shechem, simply because he is your brother —
