verses.latin: si ergo opere et veritate hoc egistis hodie cum Jerobaal et domo ejus, lætamini hodie in Abimelech, et lætetur et ipse in vobis:
verses.english: if therefore you have acted with sincerity and truth today with Jerubaal and his household, then rejoice today in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you.

verses.latin: sin autem non vultis, egrediatur ignis ab Abimelech, et consumat habitatores Sichem et oppidi Mello: et ignis de Sichem et de oppido Mello egrediatur, et devoret Abimelech.
verses.english: But if you have not, then let fire come out from Abimelech and consume the inhabitants of Shechem and the house of Millo. And let fire come out from Shechem and from the house of Millo and consume Abimelech.”

verses.latin: Cumque exsecratus esset eos, aufugit in Bera: ibique moratus est propter Abimelech fratrem suum.
verses.english: When Jotham had finished cursing them, he fled to Beer, and he stayed there because of his brother Abimelech.

verses.latin: Regnavit ergo Abimelech super Israël tribus annis.
verses.english: So Abimelech reigned over Israel for three years.

verses.latin: Immisitque Deus spiritum pessimum inter Abimelech et habitatores Sichem: qui cœperunt eum detestari.
verses.english: Then God sent an evil spirit to cause trouble between Abimelech and the inhabitants of Shechem. And the men of Shechem began to detest him.

verses.latin: Ut veniret iniquitas facta contra filios Jerobaal, et argueretur sanguis eorum super Abimelech fratrem suum, et super cæteros Sichenitas, qui eum adjuverant ad interficiendos fratres suos.
verses.english: This happened so that the evil done against Jerubaal’s sons might come to pass, and their blood would be avenged upon Abimelech, their brother, and upon the other Shechemites who had helped him kill his brothers.

verses.latin: Posueruntque insidias contra eum in summitate montium: et dum illius præstolabantur adventum, exercebant latrocinia, agentes prædas de prætereuntibus: nuntiatumque est Abimelech.
verses.english: And the men of Shechem set ambushes against him on the tops of the mountains. While they lay in wait for his coming, they committed robberies, taking plunder from those who passed by. This was reported to Abimelech.

verses.latin: Venit autem Gaal filius Obed cum fratribus suis, et transivit in Sichem: ad cujus adventum, erecti habitatores Sichem,
verses.english: But then Gaal, the son of Ebed, came with his brothers and moved into Shechem. At his arrival, the inhabitants of Shechem were encouraged.

verses.latin: egressi sunt in agros, vastantes vineas, et calcantes torcularia: factisque conviviis, et ingressi templum dei sui, comederunt simul, et biberunt, maledicentesque Abimelech:
verses.english: They went out into the fields, harvested their vineyards, and trod the grapes in the winepresses. They then held feasts, and entering the temple of their god, they ate and drank together, and they cursed Abimelech.

verses.latin: clamavit Gaal filius Obed: Quis est Abimelech, et quæ est Sichem, ut serviamus ei? Numquid non est filius Jerobaal? et Zebul servus ejus? Servite viris Emor patris Sichem: cur enim serviemus huic?
verses.english: Gaal, the son of Ebed, cried out: “Who is Abimelech, and who are we in Shechem, that we should serve him? Is he not the son of Jerubaal? And isn’t Zebul his officer? Serve the men of Hamor, the founder of Shechem! Why should we serve this man?

verses.latin: Quis mihi tribuat populum istum, ut auferam Abimelech? Diceresque Abimelech: Congrega exercitum tuum, et veni.
verses.english: If only I were given charge of this people, I would remove Abimelech! I would then say to Abimelech: ‘Gather your army and come out!’”

verses.latin: Auditis ergo Zebul, princeps civitatis, sermonibus Gaal filii Obed, iratus est vehementer:
verses.english: When Zebul, the ruler of the city, heard the words of Gaal, the son of Ebed, he became very angry.

verses.latin: et clam absconditos mittens nuntios ad Abimelech, ait: Ecce Gaal filius Obed venit in Sichem cum fratribus suis, et concitat adversum te civitatem.
verses.english: He secretly sent messengers to Abimelech, saying: “Look, Gaal, the son of Ebed, has come to Shechem with his brothers, and he is stirring up the city against you.

verses.latin: Surge ergo nocte cum populo tuo, et latita in agro:
verses.english: Therefore, rise up at night with your people and lie in wait in the fields.

verses.latin: et prima luce, oriente sole, irrue super civitatem. Cumque ille adversum te et populum suum exierit, fac ei quodcumque potueris.
verses.english: At first light, as the sun rises, rush upon the city. And when Gaal and his people come out against you, then do to him whatever you can.”

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque Abimelech cum omni exercitu suo nocte, et tetendit insidias juxta Sichem in quatuor turmas.
verses.english: So Abimelech rose up at night with all his army, and they set ambushes near Shechem in four companies.

verses.latin: Egressusque est Gaal filius Obed, et stetit in introitu portæ civitatis. Et surrexit Abimelech, et omnis exercitus cum eo de insidiis.
verses.english: And Gaal, the son of Ebed, went out and stood at the entrance of the city gate. Then Abimelech and all the army with him rose up from their ambush.

verses.latin: Et vidit Gaal populum, et ait ad Zebul: Ecce de montibus multitudo descendit. Cui respondit ille: Umbras montium vides quasi hominum capita, et hoc errore deciperis.
verses.english: Gaal saw the people and said to Zebul: “Look, a multitude is coming down from the mountains!” But Zebul answered him: “You are seeing the shadows of the mountains as if they were men’s heads, and you are being deceived by this error.”

verses.latin: Rursumque Gaal ait: Ecce de medio terræ turmæ descendunt, et una cohors venit per viam quæ respicit quercum videntium.
verses.english: Again, Gaal said: “Look, troops are coming down from the center of the land, and one company is coming by the road that looks toward the Diviners’ Oak.”

verses.latin: Cui dixit Zebul: Ubi est nunc os tuum, quo loquebaris: Quis est Abimelech, ut ei serviamus? Nonne hic est populus quem despiciebas? Egredere, et pugna contra eum.
verses.english: Then Zebul said to him: “Where is your mouth now, with which you said: ‘Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him?’ Is this not the very people you despised? Go out now and fight against him!”

verses.latin: Et abiit Gaal, spectante populo civitatis, et pugnavit contra Abimelech:
verses.english: So Gaal went out, with the people of the city watching, and fought against Abimelech.

verses.latin: qui persecutus est eum: et in fugam versus est, et vulneratus, multorumque interfecta sunt cadavera usque ad portam civitatis.
verses.english: But Abimelech pursued him. Gaal was put to flight and wounded, and many dead bodies lay slaughtered all the way to the city gate.

verses.latin: Abiit Abimelech filius Hierobaal in Sichem ad fratres matris suae, et locutus est ad eos, et ad omnem cognationem domus patris matris suae, dicens:
verses.english: Abimelech, the son of Jerubbaal, went to Shechem to his mother's brothers. He spoke to them and to all the relatives of his mother's household, saying:

verses.latin: Loquimini, quaeso, ad omnes viros Sichem: Quid vobis est melius, ut dominentur vobis septuaginta viri omnes filii Hierobaal, an ut dominetur vobis vir unus? memores praeterea quod os meum et caro mea sitis.
verses.english: "Please, speak to all the leaders of Shechem: Which is better for you: that seventy men, all the sons of Jerubbaal, rule over you, or that one man rules over you? Remember also that I am your own flesh and blood."

verses.latin: Et locuti sunt fratres matris ejus de eo cunctis viris Sichem universos sermones istos, et inclinaverunt cor eorum post Abimelech, dicentes: Caro nostra est frater noster.
verses.english: So his mother's brothers spoke all these words about him to all the leaders of Shechem. Their hearts were swayed to follow Abimelech, for they said: "He is our own flesh and blood, our brother."

verses.latin: Dederuntque illi septuaginta pondo argenti de thesauro templi Baalphakor: qui conduxit ex eo viros inopes et vagos, et secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: Then they gave him seventy pieces of silver from the treasury of the temple of Baalphakor. With this money, he hired worthless and vagrant men, and they followed him.

verses.latin: Et venit in domum patris sui in Ephra, et occidit fratres suos filios Hierobaal septuaginta viros super unum lapidem: mansitque Joatham, filius Hierobaal minimus, qui se absconderat.
verses.english: He went to his father's house in Ephra and killed his brothers, the seventy sons of Jerubbaal, on one stone. But Joatham, the youngest son of Jerubbaal, remained alive, because he had hidden himself.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt omnes viri Sichem, et universae familiae urbis Mello: abieruntque et constituerunt Abimelech regem juxta quercum, quae stabat in Sichem.
verses.english: Then all the men of Shechem and all the citizens of the city of Mello gathered together. They went and made Abimelech their king beside the oak tree that stood in Shechem.

verses.latin: Quod cum nuntiatum esset Joatham, ivit et stetit in vertice montis Garizim: et sublevata voce clamavit, et dixit: Audite me, viri Sichem, sic audiat vos Deus.
verses.english: When this was told to Joatham, he went and stood on the top of Mount Garizim. He raised his voice and cried out, saying: "Listen to me, you men of Shechem, and may God listen to you."

verses.latin: Ierunt ligna, ut ungerent super se regem: et dixerunt olivae: Impera nobis.
verses.english: "The trees once went out to anoint a king over themselves. They said to the olive tree, 'Rule over us!'"

verses.latin: Quae respondit: Numquid possum deserere pinguedinem meam, qua et dii utuntur et homines, et ire ut inter ligna promovear?
verses.english: "But the olive tree answered: 'Can I truly leave my rich oil, which both God and men use, to go and be exalted among the trees?'"

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ligna ad ficum: Veni et impera nobis.
verses.english: "Then the trees said to the fig tree: 'Come and rule over us!'"

verses.latin: Quae respondit: Numquid possum deserere dulcedinem meam, et fructus meos optimos, et ire ut inter ceteras arbores commovear?
verses.english: "But the fig tree answered: 'Can I truly leave my sweetness and my excellent fruits to go and be moved about among the other trees?'"

verses.latin: Et locuta sunt ligna ad vitem: Veni et impera nobis.
verses.english: "So the trees spoke to the grapevine: 'Come and rule over us!'"

verses.latin: Quae respondit: Numquid possum deserere vinum meum, quod laetificat Deum et homines, et inter ceteras arbores militare?
verses.english: "But the grapevine answered: 'Can I truly leave my wine, which makes God and men joyful, to go and serve among the other trees?'"

verses.latin: Dixeruntque omnia ligna ad rhamnum: Veni et impera super nos.
verses.english: "Then all the trees said to the bramble: 'Come and rule over us!'"

verses.latin: Cui respondit rhamnus: Si vere me regem facitis super vos, venite et sub umbra mea requiescite: sin autem non vultis, exeat ignis de rhamno, et devoret cedros Libani.
verses.english: "And the bramble answered them: 'If you truly want to make me your king, then come and take shelter in my shadow. But if not, let fire come out of the bramble and consume the cedars of Lebanon!'"

verses.latin: Nunc igitur, si recte et absque peccato fecistis, constituentes super vos regem Abimelech, et bene egistis cum Hierobaal et cum domo ejus, et reddidistis vicem beneficiis ejus, qui pugnavit pro vobis,
verses.english: "Now therefore, if you have acted rightly and without sin by making Abimelech your king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his household, and if you have repaid him for the good deeds he did for you, for he fought for you,"

verses.latin: et animam suam posuit juxta periculum, ut erueret vos de manu Madian,
verses.english: "and risked his own life to deliver you from the power of Midian,"

verses.latin: et vos nunc surrexistis contra domum patris mei, et interfecistis filios ejus septuaginta viros super unum lapidem, et Abimelech filium ancillae ejus fecistis regem super viros Sichem, eo quod frater vester sit:
verses.english: "yet you have risen up against my father's household today and killed his seventy sons on one stone. You have made Abimelech, the son of his maidservant, king over the men of Shechem, simply because he is your brother."

verses.latin: Si ergo juste et absque peccato egistis cum Hierobaal et domo ejus hodie, laetamini in Abimelech, et laetetur et ipse in vobis.
verses.english: "If, then, you have acted justly and without sin towards Jerubbaal and his household today, then rejoice in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you."

verses.latin: Sin autem nequiter, exeat ignis ab Abimelech, et consumat viros Sichem et oppidum Mello: et egrediatur ignis a viris Sichem et de oppido Mello, et devoret Abimelech.
verses.english: "But if you have acted wickedly, let fire come out from Abimelech and consume the men of Shechem and the city of Mello. And let fire come out from the men of Shechem and from the city of Mello and consume Abimelech!"

verses.latin: Cumque clamasset Joatham, fugit, et abiit in Bera, habitavitque ibi, metuens Abimelech fratrem suum.
verses.english: After Joatham had cried out these words, he fled and went to Bera, and lived there, fearing Abimelech, his brother.

verses.latin: Regnavit ergo Abimelech super Israel tribus annis.
verses.english: So Abimelech reigned over Israel for three years.

verses.latin: Et immisit Dominus spiritum pessimum inter Abimelech et habitatores Sichem: qui coeperunt eum detrahere.
verses.english: Then the Lord sent a destructive spirit between Abimelech and the inhabitants of Shechem. They began to betray him.

verses.latin: Ut veniret iniquitas interfectorum septuaginta filiorum Hierobaal, et defenderetur sanguis eorum super Abimelech fratrem eorum, qui interfecerat eos, et super viros Sichem, qui ejus adjuverant manus.
verses.english: This was so that the wickedness of killing the seventy sons of Jerubbaal would come upon them. Their blood would be avenged upon Abimelech, their brother who had killed them, and upon the men of Shechem who had helped him in his deeds.

verses.latin: Posueruntque insidias ei in montium summitatibus: et dum illos opperiretur in transitu, nullo prohibente, latrocinabantur.
verses.english: The men of Shechem set up ambushes against him on the mountain peaks. While they waited for people in the passes, they committed robbery with no one stopping them.

verses.latin: Venit autem Gaal filius Obed cum fratribus suis, et transivit in Sichem: cui accepti sunt habitatores Sichem.
verses.english: Now Gaal, the son of Obed, came with his brothers and moved into Shechem. The inhabitants of Shechem welcomed him.

verses.latin: Egressique in agros, depopulati sunt vineas, torcularia calcaverunt: et factis conviviis in templo dei sui, comedentes simul et bibentes, maledicebant Abimelech.
verses.english: They went out into the fields, plundered the vineyards, and trampled the winepresses. They then held feasts in the temple of their god, eating and drinking together, and they cursed Abimelech.

verses.latin: Clamavitque Gaal filius Obed: Quis est Abimelech, et quae est Sichem, ut serviamus ei? numquid non est filius Hierobaal? et Zebul servus ejus? Servite viris Emor patris Sichem: cur ergo nos serviemus illi?
verses.english: Then Gaal, the son of Obed, cried out: "Who is Abimelech, and who are we in Shechem, that we should serve him? Is he not the son of Jerubbaal? And isn't Zebul his servant? Serve the men of Emor, the father of Shechem! Why should we serve him?"

verses.latin: Utinam argilla haec sub manu mea esset, et auferrem Abimelech de medio vestrum. Dixique Abimelech: Congrega exercitum tuum et veni.
verses.english: "If only this people were under my command, I would remove Abimelech from your midst!" He then dared Abimelech: "Gather your army and come!"

verses.latin: Auditis ergo verbis Gaal filii Obed, iratus est Zebul princeps civitatis valde.
verses.english: When Zebul, the city's leader, heard the words of Gaal, the son of Obed, he became very angry.

verses.latin: Et mittens clam nuntios ad Abimelech, ait: Ecce Gaal filius Obed venit in Sichem cum fratribus suis, et concitat adversum te civitatem.
verses.english: He secretly sent messengers to Abimelech, saying: "Behold, Gaal, the son of Obed, has come to Shechem with his brothers and is stirring up the city against you."

verses.latin: Surge itaque nocte cum populo qui tecum est, et latita in agro:
verses.english: "Therefore, rise up at night with the people who are with you and lie in ambush in the field."

verses.latin: et prima luce, oriente sole, irrue super civitatem. Cumque ille egrediatur adversum te cum populo suo, fac ei quod potueris.
verses.english: "Then, at dawn, when the sun rises, rush upon the city. And when he and his people come out against you, do to him whatever you can."

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque Abimelech cum omni exercitu suo nocte, et tendit insidias juxta Sichem in quatuor turmas.
verses.english: So Abimelech rose up with all his army by night and set ambushes near Shechem in four companies.

verses.latin: Egressusque est Gaal filius Obed, et stetit in introitu portae civitatis. Et surrexit Abimelech, et omnis exercitus cum eo de insidiis.
verses.english: Gaal, the son of Obed, went out and stood at the entrance of the city gate. Then Abimelech and all the army with him rose up from their ambush.

verses.latin: Et vidit Gaal populum, et ait ad Zebul: Ecce de montibus populus descendit. Cui respondit Zebul: Umbras montium vides quasi hominum capita, et hoc errore deciperis.
verses.english: Gaal saw the people and said to Zebul: "Look! People are descending from the mountains!" Zebul answered him: "You are seeing the shadows of the mountains as if they were men's heads, and you are being deceived by this error."

verses.latin: Rursumque Gaal: Ecce, inquit, populus de umbilico terrae descendit, et una turma per viam, quae respicit quercum videntium.
verses.english: Again Gaal said: "Look, people are descending from the highest point of the land, and one company is coming by the road that looks towards the diviners' oak."

verses.latin: Cui respondit Zebul: Ubi est nunc os tuum, quo loquebaris: Quis est Abimelech ut serviamus ei? Nonne hic est populus, quem despiciebas? egredere, et pugna contra illum.
verses.english: Zebul answered him: "Where is your boasting now, when you said: 'Who is Abimelech that we should serve him?' Is this not the very people you despised? Go out now and fight against them!"

verses.latin: Et egressus est Gaal, ducatu civium Sichem, et pugnavit contra Abimelech.
verses.english: So Gaal went out, leading the citizens of Shechem, and fought against Abimelech.

verses.latin: Qui persecutus est eum, et in fugam vertit: et complures ceciderunt vulnerati usque ad portam civitatis.
verses.english: Abimelech pursued him and put him to flight. Many fell wounded, all the way to the city gate.

verses.latin: Post haec surrexit dux in Israel Thola filius Phua patrui Abimelech vir de Issachar qui habitavit in Samir montis Ephraim.
verses.english: After these events, Thola arose as a new leader in the nation of Israel. He was the son of Phua, who was Abimelech's paternal uncle. Thola was a man from the tribe of Issachar, and he lived in Samir, in the mountains of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Judicavitque Israel viginti et tribus annis et mortuus est et sepultus in Samir.
verses.english: He judged Israel for twenty-three years. Then he died and was buried in Samir.

verses.latin: Post hunc surrexit Jair Galaadites qui judicavit Israel viginti et duobus annis.
verses.english: After Thola, Jair the Galaadite arose. He judged Israel for twenty-two years.

verses.latin: Habens triginta filios sedentes super triginta pullos asinarum et triginta civitates habens quae ex nomine ejus sunt appellatae Havoth Jair usque in præsentem diem in terra Galaad.
verses.english: He had thirty sons, who rode on thirty donkey colts. He also possessed thirty cities, which were named after him, 'Havoth Jair.' These cities retain that name to the present day in the land of Galaad.

verses.latin: Mortuusque est Jair et sepultus in Camon.
verses.english: Then Jair died and was buried in Camon.

verses.latin: Addiderunt autem filii Israel facere malum in conspectu Domini et servierunt Baalim et Astaroth et diis Syriæ et Sidonis et Moab et filiorum Ammon et Philisthinorum et dimiserunt Dominum et non servierunt ei.
verses.english: But the children of Israel again did evil in the sight of the Lord. They served Baalim and Astaroth, and the gods of Syria, Sidon, Moab, the children of Ammon, and the Philistines. They abandoned the Lord and did not serve Him.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus contra Israel et tradidit eos in manu Philisthinorum et filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: So the Lord became angry with Israel and delivered them into the hands of the Philistines and the children of Ammon.

verses.latin: Afflicti sunt et adtriviti per decem et octo annos omnes filii Israel qui erant trans Jordanem in terra Amorrhæi in Galaad.
verses.english: For eighteen years, all the children of Israel who were beyond the Jordan—in the land of the Amorrhites, in Galaad—were afflicted and crushed.

verses.latin: In tantum ut transirent Jordanem et vastarent Judam et Benjamin et Ephraim et factus est Israel vehementer adflictus.
verses.english: The oppression was so severe that they even crossed the Jordan and ravaged Juda, Benjamin, and Ephraim. Israel became greatly distressed.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt filii Israel ad Dominum dicentes Peccavimus tibi quia dereliquimus Dominum Deum nostrum et servivimus Baalim.
verses.english: Then the children of Israel cried out to the Lord, saying, 'We have sinned against You, for we have forsaken the Lord our God and have served Baalim.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad filios Israel numquid non ab Ægyptiis et Amorrhæis et filiis Ammon et Philisthim.
verses.english: And the Lord said to the children of Israel, 'Did I not deliver you from the Egyptians, the Amorrhites, the children of Ammon, and the Philistines?'

verses.latin: A Sidoniis quoque et Amalech et Chananæis oppressis vobis clamastis ad me et erui vos de manu eorum.
verses.english: 'When the Sidonians, Amalech, and the Chananæans oppressed you, you cried out to Me, and I delivered you from their hand.'

verses.latin: Et tamen me dereliquistis et servistis diis alienis idcirco non addam ut ultra vos liberem.
verses.english: 'Yet you have forsaken Me and served strange gods. Therefore, I will no longer deliver you.'

verses.latin: Ite et invocate deos quos elegistis ipsi vos liberent in tempore angustiæ.
verses.english: 'Go and invoke the gods whom you have chosen. Let them deliver you in the time of your distress.'

verses.latin: Dixeruntque filii Israel ad Dominum Peccavimus redde nobis quidquid tibi placet tantum nunc libera nos.
verses.english: Then the children of Israel said to the Lord, 'We have sinned; do to us whatever pleases You. Only deliver us now.'

verses.latin: Et projecerunt deos alienos de medio sui et servierunt Domino qui curvatus est super miseriis eorum.
verses.english: And they cast away the strange gods from their midst and served the Lord, who was moved by their miseries.

verses.latin: Confestimque filii Ammon convocati in Galaad castrametati sunt ad quorum conspectum congregati filii Israel in Maspha.
verses.english: Immediately, the children of Ammon were gathered together in Galaad and encamped there. When the children of Israel saw them, they also gathered in Maspha.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque principes Galaad unusquisque ad proximum suum Qui primus ex nobis contra filios Ammon cœperit dimicare erit dux populi Galaad.
verses.english: And the princes of Galaad said, each to his neighbor, 'Whoever among us first begins to fight against the children of Ammon shall be the leader of the people of Galaad.'

verses.latin: Erat autem Jephte Galaadites vir fortissimus, et filius mulieris meretricis, qui natus est de Galaad.
verses.english: There was a man named Jephthah the Gileadite, a very strong warrior. He was the son of a prostitute woman, and Gilead was his father.

verses.latin: Cum autem peperisset uxoris Galaad filios, et illius uxoris crevicissent filii, ejecerunt Jephte, dicentes: Non poteris in domo patris nostri hæreditatem possidere, quia de matre alterius natus es.
verses.english: But when Gilead’s lawful wife had borne sons, and these sons grew up, they drove Jephthah out. They said, 'You will not be allowed to inherit anything in our father’s house, because you are the son of another woman.'

verses.latin: Effugit a fratribus suis, et habitavit in terra Tob: congregatique sunt ad eum viri inopes, et latrocinabantur cum eo.
verses.english: So Jephthah fled from his brothers and lived in the land of Tob. There, desperate men gathered to him, and they went out on raids with him.

verses.latin: Post multos dierum spatios pugnabant filii Ammon contra Israël.
verses.english: After many days passed, the Ammonites began to fight against Israel.

verses.latin: Cumque pergerent, vocaverunt seniores Galaad Jephte de terra Tob,
verses.english: As the Ammonites continued their advance, the elders of Gilead went to Jephthah in the land of Tob,

verses.latin: et dixerunt ei: Veni et esto princeps noster, et pugna contra filios Ammon.
verses.english: and said to him, 'Come, and be our leader so you can fight against the Ammonites.'

verses.latin: Quibus Jephte respondit: Nonne vos estis qui odistis me, et ejecistis de domo patris mei? et nunc venistis ad me necessitate compulsi?
verses.english: Jephthah answered them, 'Was it not you who hated me and drove me from my father’s house? Why have you come to me now, only when you are in trouble?'

verses.latin: Et dixerunt seniores Galaad ad Jephte: Ob hanc igitur causam nunc ad te venimus, ut proficiscaris nobiscum, et pugnes contra filios Ammon, sisque caput omnium qui habitant in Galaad.
verses.english: The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, 'For this reason, we have indeed come to you now. If you go with us and fight against the Ammonites, you will be the head of all who live in Gilead.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Jephte ad eos: Si revertamini ad me, et tradatis mihi ut pugnem pro vobis contra filios Ammon, tradente Domino in manu mea, ego ero princeps vester.
verses.english: Jephthah said to them, 'If you bring me back to fight for you against the Ammonites, and if the Lord gives them into my hand, then I will be your leader.'

verses.latin: Et dixerunt principes Galaad ad Jephte: Dominus qui hæc audit, ipse est arbiter et interpres sermonum nostrorum.
verses.english: The princes of Gilead said to Jephthah, 'The Lord, who hears these things, will be the judge and witness of our agreement.'

verses.latin: Abiit itaque Jephte cum principibus Galaad, fecitque eum omnis populus principem, et ducem. Locutusque est Jephte omnes sermones suos coram Domino in Maspha.
verses.english: So Jephthah went with the princes of Gilead, and all the people made him their leader and commander. Then Jephthah repeated all his intentions and terms before the Lord in Mizpah.

verses.latin: Et misit nuntios ad regem filiorum Ammon, qui dicerent ex nomine ejus: Quid mihi et tibi est, quia venisti contra me ut vastes terram meam?
verses.english: Then Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites with a message from him, saying: 'What conflict do you have with me, that you have come against me to lay waste my land?'

verses.latin: Cui respondit rex filiorum Ammon: Quia tulit Israël terram meam quando ascendit de Ægypto, a finibus Arnon usque Jaboc atque Jordanem: nunc igitur redde eas mihi cum pace.
verses.english: The king of the Ammonites answered Jephthah: 'Because Israel took my land when they came up from Egypt, from the Arnon to the Jabbok and to the Jordan River. Now therefore, restore those lands to me peacefully.'

verses.latin: Et addidit Jephte, mittens nuntios rursum ad regem Ammon,
verses.english: Jephthah again sent messengers back to the king of the Ammonites,

verses.latin: qui dicerent ei: Hæc dicit Jephte: Non tulit Israël terram Moab, nec terram filiorum Ammon:
verses.english: to tell him: 'This is what Jephthah says: Israel did not take the land of Moab, nor the land of the Ammonites.'

verses.latin: sed quando de Ægypto egrediebantur, ambulavit per solitudinem usque ad mare Rubrum, et venit in Cades.
verses.english: Instead, when they were coming out of Egypt, they traveled through the wilderness to the Red Sea and then came to Kadesh.

verses.latin: Misitque nuntios ad regem Edom, dicens: Dimitte me, ut transeam per terram tuam. Qui noluit acquiscere precibus ejus. Misit quoque et ad regem Moab, qui et ipse transitum negavit: mansitque Israël in Cades.
verses.english: Then Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, 'Allow me to pass through your land.' But Edom’s king would not agree to their requests. They also sent to the king of Moab, who likewise denied them passage. So Israel remained in Kadesh.

verses.latin: Et circuivit solitudinem, et omnem terram Edom, atque Moab, et venit contra orientalem plagam terræ Moab: et castrametatus est trans Arnon, nec voluit intrare terminos Moab: Arnon est enim inter fines Moab et Amorrhæi.
verses.english: So Israel circled around the wilderness and all the land of Edom and Moab, and they came to the eastern side of the land of Moab. They camped beyond the Arnon River, because they did not want to enter the territory of Moab. Indeed, the Arnon forms the border between Moab and the Amorites.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Israël nuntios ad Sehon regem Amorrhæorum, qui regnabat in Hesebon, et dixerunt ei: Dimitte nos ut transeamus per terram tuam ad fluvium.
verses.english: Therefore, Israel sent messengers to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, and they said to him: 'Allow us to pass through your land to our own river.'

verses.latin: Qui et ipse, Israël non credens, quod transiret per fines suos, exercitum grandem congregavit, et veniens in Jasa, resistit ei.
verses.english: But even Sihon, not trusting that Israel would merely pass through his territory, gathered a large army and came to Jahaz, where he resisted them.

verses.latin: Tradiditque Dominus Deus Israël Sehon cum omni exercitu suo in manu Israël: qui percussit eum, et possedit omnem terram Amorrhæi habitatoris regionis illius.
verses.english: Then the Lord God of Israel delivered Sihon with all his army into the hand of Israel, who struck him down and took possession of all the land of the Amorite inhabitants of that region.

verses.latin: Et omnes fines Amorrhæi, a finibus Arnon usque Jaboc, et de solitudine usque ad Jordanem.
verses.english: And all the territory of the Amorites, from the Arnon River to the Jabbok River, and from the wilderness to the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Igitur Dominus Deus Israël subvertit Amorrhæum, habitantes in terris Chanaan, a facie populi sui Israël: et tu nunc vis possidere eam?
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God of Israel overthrew the Amorites, who dwelt in the land of Canaan, before His people Israel. And now, do you intend to possess it yourself?

verses.latin: Nonne ea quæ possedit Chamos deus tuus, tibi jure debentur? Et quæ Dominus Deus noster victor obtinuit, in nostram cedent possessionem?
verses.english: Do you not possess by right whatever your god Chemosh allows you to possess? So, whatever the Lord our God victoriously obtained, shall that not become our possession?

verses.latin: Nisi forte melior es Balac filio Sephor rege Moab: aut potes ei aliquid imperare?
verses.english: Are you perhaps better than Balak, the son of Zippor, king of Moab? Or can you command anything against him?

verses.latin: Quando habitavit Israël in Hesebon et viculis ejus, et in Aroer et vicis ejus, et in cunctis civitatibus juxta Jordanem, trecentis annis? quare tanto tempore nihil super hac re attentasti?
verses.english: When Israel lived in Heshbon and its villages, and in Aroer and its villages, and in all the cities along the Jordan River, for three hundred years—why did you not attempt anything regarding this matter during all that time?

verses.latin: Igitur ego non peccavi in te, sed tu male agis contra me, inferens mihi bella. Judicet Dominus arbiter hujus diei inter Israël et inter filios Ammon.
verses.english: Therefore, I have not sinned against you, but you are acting wickedly against me by bringing war upon me. May the Lord, the Judge, decide this day between Israel and the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Noluitque acquiescere rex filiorum Ammon sermonibus Jephte, quos per nuntios mandaverat ei.
verses.english: But the king of the Ammonites would not agree to the words that Jephthah had sent to him through messengers.

verses.latin: Factus est ergo super Jephte spiritus Domini, et circuiens Galaad et Manasse, Maspha quoque Galaad, et inde transiens ad filios Ammon,
verses.english: Therefore, the Spirit of the Lord came upon Jephthah, and he marched through Gilead and Manasseh, even Mizpah of Gilead, and from there he crossed over to the Ammonites.

verses.latin: vovit votum Domino, dicens: Si tradideris filios Ammon in manus meas,
verses.english: Then Jephthah made a solemn vow to the Lord, saying: 'If You will indeed deliver the Ammonites into my hands,'

verses.latin: quicumque primus de foribus domus meæ occurrerit mihi, revertenti cum pace a filiis Ammon, erit holocaustum Domino.
verses.english: then whatever comes out of the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the Ammonites, will be a burnt offering to the Lord.'

verses.latin: Transivitque Jephte ad filios Ammon, ut pugnaret contra eos: et tradidit eos Dominus in manu ejus.
verses.english: So Jephthah went over to the Ammonites to fight against them, and the Lord delivered them into his hand.

verses.latin: Percussitque eos ab Aroer, usque dum venias in Mennith, viginti civitates, et usque ad Abel, quæ est vineis consita, cæde magna nimis. Humiliatique sunt filii Ammon a facie filiorum Israël.
verses.english: And he struck them down from Aroer all the way to Minnith, capturing twenty cities, and even to Abel-keramim, which was filled with vineyards, with an exceedingly great slaughter. Thus, the Ammonites were humbled before the Israelites.

verses.latin: Cumque reversus esset Jephte in Maspha domum suam, occurrit ei unigenita filia sua cum tympanis et choris, ipse primus obviam veniens. Hæc enim sola filia erat.
verses.english: Now when Jephthah returned to his house in Mizpah, his only daughter came out to meet him with tambourines and dances, for she was the first to come to meet him. Indeed, she was his only daughter.

verses.latin: Qua visa, scidit vestimenta sua, et ait: Heu me, filia mea, decepisti me, et ipsa decepta es: aperui os meum ad Dominum, et non potero ultra facere.
verses.english: When he saw her, he tore his clothes and cried out: 'Alas, my daughter! You have truly undone me, and you yourself are undone, for I have opened my mouth with a vow to the Lord, and I cannot go back on it!'

verses.latin: Cui illa respondit: Pater mi, si aperuisti os tuum ad Dominum, fac mihi quodcumque pollicitus es, et peracta est in te de inimicis tuis ultio Domini.
verses.english: To him, she replied: 'My father, if you have opened your mouth to the Lord with a vow, then do to me whatever you have promised, since by this, the Lord’s vengeance has been fully accomplished against your enemies through you.'

verses.latin: Dixitque patri suo: Hoc solum mihi concede quod postulo: dimitte me ut duobus mensibus circumeam montes, et plangam virginitatem meam cum sodalibus meis.
verses.english: Then she said to her father: 'Grant me only this one thing that I ask: let me go for two months so I can wander the mountains and lament my virginity with my companions.'

verses.latin: Cui ille respondit: Vade. Et dimisit eam duobus mensibus. Cumque abisset cum sodalibus suis, planxit virginitatem suam in montibus.
verses.english: He replied to her, 'Go.' And he sent her away for two months. So she departed with her companions and bewailed her virginity in the mountains.

verses.latin: Expletisque duobus mensibus, reversa est ad patrem suum, et fecit ei sicut voverat, quæ et ignorabat virum. Ab illo tempore in Israël consuetudo manavit, et obtinuit:
verses.english: When the two months were over, she returned to her father, and he did to her as he had vowed. And she had never known a man. From that time on, a custom spread throughout Israel and became established:

verses.latin: ut post anni circulum conveniant in unum filiæ Israël, et plangant filiam Jephte Galaaditæ dierum quattuor.
verses.english: that after a year’s cycle, the daughters of Israel would gather together and lament the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite for four days.

verses.latin: Cumque uxorem habuisset Galaad, et peperisset ei filios, qui postquam creverant, ejecerunt Jephte, dicentes: Non poteris in domo patris nostri hæreditatem possidere, quia de matre meretrice natus es.
verses.english: Gilead's legitimate wife bore him sons. When these sons grew up, they drove Jephthah away, telling him: "You cannot inherit anything in our father's house because your mother was a prostitute."

verses.latin: Quam ob rem fugiens Jephte a fratribus suis, habitavit in terra Tob: congregatique sunt ad eum viri inopes, et latrocinantes secuti sunt eum.
verses.english: So Jephthah fled from his brothers and lived in the land of Tob. There, desperate and impoverished men gathered around him and became his followers, engaging in raids with him.

verses.latin: Paucis post diebus, pugnabant filii Ammon adversum Israël.
verses.english: A short time later, the Ammonites began to wage war against the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Cumque ad bellandum pergerent, majores natu de Galaad, abierunt ut de terra Tob ad se accersirent Jephte:
verses.english: As the war intensified, the elders of Gilead went to the land of Tob to summon Jephthah back to them.

verses.latin: dixeruntque ad eum: Veni, et esto princeps noster, et pugna contra filios Ammon.
verses.english: They said to him: "Come and become our leader, and fight against the Ammonites for us."

verses.latin: Quibus Jephte respondit: Nonne vos estis qui odistis me, et ejecistis de domo patris mei? et nunc venitis ad me necessitate compulsi?
verses.english: Jephthah replied to them: "Were you not the ones who hated me and drove me out from my father's house? Why do you come to me now, only when you are forced by necessity?"

verses.latin: At illi ad Jephte dixerunt: Ob hanc igitur causam nunc ad te venimus, ut proficiscaris nobiscum, et pugnes contra filios Ammon, sisque caput omnium qui habitant in Galaad.
verses.english: But they said to Jephthah: "For this very reason we have come to you now—so that you may go with us and fight against the Ammonites, and you will become the head over all who live in Gilead."

verses.latin: Dixitque Jephte ad eos: Si vere venistis ad me, ut pugnem pro vobis contra filios Ammon, tradente Domino in manu mea hoste, ego ero princeps vester?
verses.english: Jephthah then said to them: "If you have truly come to me so that I may fight for you against the Ammonites, and if the Lord hands the enemy into my power, will I truly be your leader?"

verses.latin: Qui responderunt ei: Dominus, qui hæc audit, ipse est mediator et testis, quod quæ locuti sumus, implebimus opere.
verses.english: They answered him: "The Lord, who hears these words, He Himself is the arbiter and witness, that what we have promised, we will fulfill in deed."

verses.latin: Abiit itaque Jephte cum principibus Galaad, fecitque eum omnis populus principem et ducem sui. Locutusque est Jephte omnes sermones suos, coram Domino in Maspha.
verses.english: So Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and all the people made him their leader and commander. Jephthah then spoke all his solemn words and promises before the Lord in Mizpah.

verses.latin: Misitque nuntios ad regem filiorum Ammon, qui ex suo nomine dicerent: Quid mihi et tibi est, quia venisti contra me, ut vastares terram meam?
verses.english: Jephthah then sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites, to say in his name: "What dispute is between us, that you have come against me to lay waste to my land?"

verses.latin: Quibus ille respondit: Quia abstulit Israël terram meam, quando ascendit de Ægypto, a finibus Arnon usque Jaboc atque Jordanem: nunc igitur redde mihi eam cum pace.
verses.english: To them, the king of Ammon replied: "Because Israel took away my land when they came up from Egypt, from the borders of the Arnon River all the way to the Jabbok River and the Jordan River. Therefore, return it to me now peacefully."

verses.latin: Et rursum misit Jephte nuntios ad regem filiorum Ammon,
verses.english: Jephthah, in turn, sent messengers again to the king of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: qui jussit ei dicere: Hæc dicit Jephte: Non abstulit Israël terram Moab, nec terram filiorum Ammon:
verses.english: He commanded them to tell the Ammonite king: "Jephthah says this: Israel did not take away the land of Moab, nor the land of the Ammonites."

verses.latin: sed quando de Ægypto egrediebantur, et transierunt per solitudinem usque ad Mare Rubrum, et venerunt in Cades,
verses.english: "Instead, when they came out of Egypt, they traveled through the wilderness to the Red Sea, and then they came to Kadesh."

verses.latin: misit Israël nuntios ad regem Edom, dicens: Dimitte me ut transeam per terram tuam. Qui noluit adquiescere precibus ejus. Misit quoque et ad regem Moab, qui et ipse transitum præbere contempsit: mansitque Israël in Cades.
verses.english: "Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying: 'Allow me to pass through your land.' But he refused to agree to their requests. They also sent to the king of Moab, who likewise scorned to grant them passage. So Israel remained in Kadesh."

verses.latin: Et circuivit omnem terram Edom, et terram Moab, venitque contra orientalem plagam terræ Moab, et castrametatus est trans Arnon: nec voluit intrare terminos Moab. Erat quippe Arnon terminus terræ Moab.
verses.english: "And so, Israel went around all the land of Edom and the land of Moab, and they came to the eastern side of the land of Moab. They camped beyond the Arnon River, and they did not wish to enter the territory of Moab, because the Arnon River was indeed the border of the land of Moab."

verses.latin: Misit ergo Israël nuntios ad Sehon regem Amorrhæorum, qui habitabat in Hesebon, et dixerunt ei: Dimitte nos, ut transeamus per terram tuam usque ad fluvium.
verses.english: "Therefore, Israel sent messengers to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and they said to him: 'Allow us to pass through your land all the way to the river.'"

verses.latin: Qui et ipse Israël transire per fines suos non permisit, sed congregato exercitu, egressus est contra eum in Jasa, et fortiter resistebat.
verses.english: "But he also did not allow Israel to pass through his territory. Instead, he gathered his army, went out against them at Jahaz, and strongly resisted them in battle."

verses.latin: Tradiditque Dominus Deus Israël Sehon cum omni exercitu suo in manu Israël: qui percussit eum, et possedit omnem terram Amorrhæi habitatoris regionis illius,
verses.english: "And the Lord God of Israel delivered Sihon with all his army into the hand of Israel. Israel defeated him and took possession of all the land of that region's Amorite inhabitants."

verses.latin: et universos fines ejus, de Arnon usque Jaboc, et de solitudine usque ad Jordanem.
verses.english: "And they possessed all his territory, from the Arnon River to the Jabbok River, and from the wilderness to the Jordan River."

verses.latin: Igitur Dominus Deus Israël tulit Amorrhæum, pugnante contra illum populo suo Israël, et tu nunc vis possidere terram ejus?
verses.english: "So then, the Lord God of Israel drove out the Amorites, with His people Israel fighting against them. And now you, Ammonites, want to take possession of their land, which is now ours?"

verses.latin: Nonne ea quæ possidet Chamos Deus tuus, tibi jure debentur? Et quæ Dominus Deus noster victor obtinuit, in nostram cedent possessionem.
verses.english: "Do you not possess by right whatever Chemosh, your god, has given you? So also, what the Lord our God has victoriously obtained, shall pass into our possession."

verses.latin: Nisi forte major es Balac filio Sephor rege Moab, aut potes ei aliquid imperare:
verses.english: "Unless perhaps you are greater than Balak, son of Zippor, king of Moab, or you can command him to do something."

verses.latin: quando habitavit Israël in Hesebon et viculis ejus, et in Aroer et vicis ejus, omnesque civitates juxta Jordanem, trecentis annis? Quare tanto tempore nihil super hac re attentasti?
verses.english: "For three hundred years, Israel has lived in Heshbon and its surrounding villages, and in Aroer and its villages, and in all the cities along the Jordan River. Why, during all this time, have you not attempted anything about this matter?"

verses.latin: Igitur ego non peccavi in te, sed tu male agis contra me, inferens mihi bella non justa. Judicet Dominus judex hodie inter Israël, et inter filios Ammon.
verses.english: "Therefore, I have not sinned against you. Rather, you are acting wickedly against me by bringing unjust wars upon me. May the Lord, the Judge, decide today between Israel and the Ammonites."

verses.latin: Noluitque rex filiorum Ammon adquiescere sermonibus Jephte, quos per nuntios mandaverat.
verses.english: But the king of the Ammonites refused to listen to the words that Jephthah had sent to him through his messengers.

verses.latin: Factus est ergo super Jephte spiritus Domini, et circuiens Galaad, et Manasse, Maspha quoque Galaad, inde transiit ad filios Ammon:
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord came upon Jephthah, empowering him. He passed through Gilead and Manasseh, then through Mizpah of Gilead, and from there he advanced against the Ammonites.

verses.latin: votumque vovit Domino, dicens: Si tradideris filios Ammon in manu mea,
verses.english: And Jephthah made a solemn vow to the Lord, saying: "If You will deliver the Ammonites into my hand,"

verses.latin: quicumque primus de foribus domus meæ occurrerit mihi revertenti cum pace a filiis Ammon, eum holocaustum offeram Domino.
verses.english: "Then whoever comes out first from the doors of my house to meet me when I return in peace from the Ammonites, that person I will offer up as a burnt offering to the Lord." This vow indicates a human sacrifice, a forbidden practice, which Jephthah misunderstands as pleasing to God.

verses.latin: Transivitque Jephte ad filios Ammon, ut pugnaret contra eos: tradiditque eos Dominus in manu ejus.
verses.english: So Jephthah crossed over to the Ammonites to fight against them, and the Lord delivered them into his hand.

verses.latin: Et percussit ab Aroer usque dum venias in Mennith, viginti civitates, et usque ad Abel, quæ est vinearum, cæde magna nimis: humiliatique sunt filii Ammon a filiis Israël.
verses.english: He struck them down from Aroer all the way to Minnith, capturing twenty cities, and continuing as far as Abel-Keramim, which means "plain of the vineyards," inflicting an exceedingly great slaughter upon them. Thus, the Ammonites were subdued by the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Cumque revertetur Jephte in Maspha domum suam, occurrit ei unigenita filia sua cum tympanis et choris læta. Erat enim ei filia unica, nec habebat alios liberos.
verses.english: When Jephthah returned to his house in Mizpah, his only daughter came out to meet him, celebrating with tambourines and dances. She was his only child; he had no other sons or daughters.

verses.latin: Qua visa, scidit vestimenta sua, et ait: Heu me, filia mea, decepisti me, et ipsa decepta es: aperui os meum ad Dominum, et non potero facere aliud.
verses.english: When he saw her, he tore his clothes and cried out: "Oh, my daughter! You have brought me to despair, and you yourself are in despair! I have opened my mouth in a solemn vow to the Lord, and I cannot go back on it."

verses.latin: Cui illa respondit: Pater mi, si aperuisti os tuum ad Dominum, fac mihi quodcumque pollicitus es, concessa tibi victoria atque ultione de hostibus tuis.
verses.english: To him, she replied: "My father, if you have opened your mouth in a vow to the Lord, do to me whatever you have promised, since the Lord has granted you victory and vengeance over your enemies."

verses.latin: Dixitque patri: Hoc solum mihi præsta quod postulo: dimitte me ut duobus mensibus circueam montes, et plangam virginitatem meam cum sodalibus meis.
verses.english: She then said to her father: "Grant me only this one request: let me go for two months to wander among the mountains and mourn my virginity with my companions."

verses.latin: Cui ille respondit: Vade. Dimisitque eam duobus mensibus. Cumque abisset cum sodalibus suis, flevit virginitatem suam in montibus.
verses.english: He answered her: "Go." And he sent her away for two months. When she had gone with her companions, she wept over her virginity in the mountains.

verses.latin: Expletisque duobus mensibus, reversa est ad patrem suum, et fecit ei sicut voverat: quæ ignorebat virum. Exinde mos prævaluit in Israël, et consuetudo servata est:
verses.english: When the two months were completed, she returned to her father, and he did to her as he had vowed. She had known no man, remaining a virgin. From that time on, a custom prevailed in Israel and was observed:

verses.latin: ut post anni circulum conveniant in unum filiæ Israël, et plangant filiam Jephte Galaaditæ diebus quatuor.
verses.english: That year after year, the daughters of Israel would gather together and lament for the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite, for four days.

verses.latin: Clamaverunt autem viri Ephraim, et transierunt ad aquilonem, et dixerunt ad Jephte: Cur transisti ut pugnares contra filios Ammon, et nos non vocasti ut iremus tecum? Hanc igitur ignominiam non feres, quin te et domum tuam igne comburamus.
verses.english: The men from the tribe of Ephraim then gathered themselves and crossed to the northern region, confronting Jephthah. They demanded: "Why did you go to war against the Ammonites, and not call us to come with you? You will not get away with this insult to our honor; we will burn you and your entire household with fire!"

verses.latin: Quibus respondit Jephte: Ego et populus meus magna passa sumus certamina contra filios Ammon: et vos, cum vehementer implorarer, non tribuistis mihi auxilium.
verses.english: Jephthah replied to them: "My people and I endured fierce battles against the Ammonites. And when I desperately called for your help, you did not provide any assistance."

verses.latin: Vidensque quod nollent succurrere, periclitatus sum animam meam, et transivi ad filios Ammon: et tradidit eos Dominus in manus meas. Cur igitur hodie venistis contra me pugnare?
verses.english: Seeing that you were unwilling to offer any assistance, I risked my life and went against the Ammonites. The Lord delivered them into my hands. Why, then, have you come today to fight against me?

verses.latin: Et dixit Jephte ad omnes viros Galaad: Certamen meum et vestrum est contra Ephraim, qui dixerunt: Fugitivi Galaaditis estis a mediis Ephraim et Manasse.
verses.english: Jephthah then said to all the men of Gilead: "The conflict is now between me, all of you, and Ephraim. For they have said, 'You Gileadites are nothing but runaways from among Ephraim and Manasseh!'"

verses.latin: Occupavit itaque Galaaditis omnes transitus Jordanis, per quos Ephraim reversurus erat: cumque venisset ad eos de Ephraim singuli, atque diceret: Obsecro ut me transire permittas:
verses.english: Therefore, the Gileadites occupied all the fords of the Jordan River, through which the men of Ephraim were expected to return. When any man from Ephraim approached them there and said, "Please let me cross over,"

verses.latin: Dicebant ei: Numquid Ephrateus es? Qui cum respondisset: Non sum: Ajebant: Dic ergo Scibboleth: quod interpretatur Spica. Qui si aliter pronuntiasset, quam auribus eorum insensum est, statim apprehensum jugulabant ad transitus Jordanis. Et ceciderunt in illo tempore de Ephraim quadraginta duo millia.
verses.english: The Gileadites would ask him, "Are you an Ephraimite?" When he answered, "No, I am not," they would say, "Then say 'Shibboleth'—"a word that means 'ear of grain'. If he pronounced it differently from how it sounded to their ears, he was immediately seized and killed at the Jordan River fords. At that time, forty-two thousand men from Ephraim died in this way.

verses.latin: Judicavitque Jephte Galaadites Israel sex annis: et mortuus est, ac sepultus in civitate sua Galaad.
verses.english: So Jephthah the Gileadite judged Israel for six years. Then he died and was buried in his city, Gilead.

verses.latin: Post hunc judicavit Israel Abesan de Bethlehem.
verses.english: After him, Abesan from Bethlehem judged Israel.

verses.latin: Qui habuit triginta filios, et triginta filias: quas emisit foras, et de foris accipiens filiis suis uxores. Judicavitque Israel septem annis:
verses.english: He had thirty sons and thirty daughters. He sent his daughters out to be married, and brought wives for his sons from outside his family. He judged Israel for seven years.

verses.latin: Et mortuus est, ac sepultus in Bethlehem.
verses.english: Then he died and was buried in Bethlehem.

verses.latin: Huic successit Ahialon Zabulonites: et judicavit Israel octo annis:
verses.english: Ahialon the Zebulunite succeeded him and judged Israel for eight years.

verses.latin: Mortuusque est, ac sepultus in Zabulon.
verses.english: Then he died and was buried in Zebulun.

verses.latin: Post hunc judicavit Israel Abdon filius Illel Pharathonites:
verses.english: After him, Abdon, the son of Hillel, from Pirathon, judged Israel.

verses.latin: Cui fuerunt quadraginta filii, et triginta ex eis nepotes, sedentes super septuaginta pullos asinarum: et judicavit Israel octo annis:
verses.english: He had forty sons and thirty grandsons, and they rode on seventy young donkeys—a sign of their wealth and status. He judged Israel for eight years.

verses.latin: Mortuusque est, ac sepultus in Pharathon, in terra Ephraim, in monte Amalec.
verses.english: Then he died and was buried in Pirathon, in the land of Ephraim, on the mount of the Amalekites.

verses.latin: Fecerunt autem filii Israel et addiderunt facere malum in conspectu Domini: tradiditque eos in manu Philisthinorum quadraginta annis.
verses.english: The sons of Israel once again did evil in the sight of the Lord God. So He delivered them into the power of the Philistines for forty long years.

verses.latin: Erat autem vir quidam de Saraa et de stirpe Dan, nomine Manue, cui uxor sterilis erat et non pariebat liberos.
verses.english: Now there was a man from Zorah, from the tribe of Dan, whose name was Manoah. His wife was barren, and she had not been able to bear any children.

verses.latin: Apparuitque ei angelus Domini et ait: Sterilis es et absque liberis: conceptura es et paritura filium.
verses.english: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to Manoah's wife and told her: "You are barren and without children, but you are going to conceive and give birth to a son."

verses.latin: Cave ergo ne vinum et siceram bibas, et ne immundum quidquam comedas:
verses.english: "Therefore, be careful not to drink any wine or strong drink, and do not eat anything unclean."

verses.latin: quia concipies et paries filium, cuius caput non tanget ferrum, quia Nazaraeus Domini erit ab infantia sua et ex utero matris suæ: et ipse incipiet liberare Israel de manu Philisthinorum.
verses.english: "For you will conceive and give birth to a son whose head no razor blade shall touch. This is because he will be a Nazirite, consecrated to the Lord God from his very birth, from his mother's womb. And he himself will begin to deliver Israel from the power of the Philistines."

verses.latin: Venit ergo mulier et indicavit viro suo, dicens: Venit vir Dei ad me, habens vultum angelicum, terribilis nimis: quem cum interrogarem unde esset, et quo nomine vocaretur, noluit mihi dicere:
verses.english: So the woman went and told her husband, saying: "A man of God came to me, with an angelic appearance, very awe-inspiring. When I asked him where he was from and what his name was, he refused to tell me."

verses.latin: sed hoc respondit: Ecce concipies et paries filium: cave ne vinum et siceram bibas, et ne aliquid immundum comedas: quia Nazaraeus Dei erit puer ex utero matris suæ usque ad diem mortis suæ.
verses.english: "Instead, he responded with this: 'Behold, you will conceive and give birth to a son. Be careful not to drink wine or strong drink, and do not eat anything unclean, because the boy will be a Nazirite of God from his mother's womb until the day of his death.'"

verses.latin: Orabat itaque Manue Dominum et dicebat: Obsecro Domine, ut vir Dei quem misisti, veniat iterum ad nos, et doceat nos quid debeamus facere de puero qui nasciturus est.
verses.english: So Manoah prayed to the Lord God, saying: "Oh, please, Lord, let the man of God whom You sent come to us again, and teach us what we ought to do for the boy who is about to be born."

verses.latin: Et exaudivit Dominus precantem Manue, et rursum angelus Domini apparuit uxori eius sedenti in agro: Manue autem maritus eius non erat cum ea.
verses.english: And the Lord God heard Manoah's prayer. Again, the angel of the Lord appeared to his wife while she was sitting in the field. But Manoah, her husband, was not with her.

verses.latin: Quæ cum vidisset angelum, festinavit et cucurrit ad virum suum: nuntiavitque ei dicens: Ecce apparuit mihi vir quem ante videram.
verses.english: When she saw the angel, she hurried and ran to her husband, announcing to him: "Look, the man whom I saw before has appeared to me again!"

verses.latin: Surrexit Manue, et secutus est uxorem suam: venientesque ad virum, dixit ei: Tu es qui locutus es cum muliere? Et ille respondit: Ego sum.
verses.english: Manoah arose and followed his wife. When they came to the man, Manoah asked him: "Are you the one who spoke with this woman?" And he answered: "I am."

verses.latin: Cui Manue: Quando, inquit, sermo tuus fuerit expletus, quid vis ut faciat puer, aut a quo se observet?
verses.english: Manoah then asked him: "When your message is fulfilled, what do you want the boy to do? Or by what rules should he live?"

verses.latin: Responditque angelus Domini ad Manue: Ab omnibus quæ locutus sum uxori tuæ, abstineat se:
verses.english: The angel of the Lord answered Manoah: "From everything I told your wife, he must abstain."

verses.latin: et quicquid ex vinea nascitur, non comedat, et vinum ac siceram non bibat, et omne immundum non vescatur, et quæ præcepi, custodiat.
verses.english: "Whatever comes from the grapevine he shall not eat. He must not drink wine or strong drink, and he shall not eat anything unclean. All that I commanded, he must observe."

verses.latin: Dixitque Manue ad angelum Domini: Obsecro te ut moreris paulisper, et faciamus tibi hædum de capris.
verses.english: Manoah then said to the angel of the Lord: "Please, stay a little while, and we will prepare a young goat for you."

verses.latin: Cui respondit angelus Domini: Si me coëgeris, non comedam de panibus tuis: sin autem vis holocaustum facere, offer illud Domino. Non enim sciebat Manue quia angelus Domini esset.
verses.english: The angel of the Lord answered him: "Even if you compel me, I will not eat your food. But if you wish to offer a burnt offering, offer it to the Lord God." Manoah did not realize that it was an angel of the Lord.

verses.latin: Dixitque Manue ad angelum Domini: Quod est nomen tuum, ut si sermo tuus fuerit expletus, honoremus te?
verses.english: Manoah then said to the angel of the Lord: "What is your name, so that when your message is fulfilled, we may honor you?"

verses.latin: Cui ille respondit: Cur quæris nomen meum, quod est mirabile?
verses.english: To this, he responded: "Why do you ask my name? It is wondrous, beyond understanding."

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Manue hædum de capris et libamenta, et posuit super petram, offerens Domino, qui facit mirabilia.
verses.english: So Manoah took a young goat and a grain offering, and he placed them on a rock, offering them to the Lord God, who performs wondrous acts.

verses.latin: Cumque ascenderet flamma de altari in cælum, angelus Domini in flamma pariter ascendit. Quod cum vidissent Manue et uxor eius, ceciderunt in terram proni.
verses.english: As the flame ascended from the altar toward the sky, the angel of the Lord also ascended in the flame. When Manoah and his wife saw this, they fell face down to the ground.

verses.latin: Et ultra non apparuit eis angelus Domini. Et intellexit Manue quia angelus Domini esset.
verses.english: The angel of the Lord did not appear to them again. Then Manoah understood that it had been an angel of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad uxorem suam: Certo moriemur, quia vidimus Deum.
verses.english: And he said to his wife: "We will surely die, because we have seen God."

verses.latin: Cui respondit uxor: Si voluisset Dominus occidere nos, non suscepisset de manibus nostris holocaustum et libamenta, neque ostendisset nobis omnia hæc, nec ea quæ ventura sunt, locutus esset.
verses.english: His wife responded to him: "If the Lord God had wished to kill us, He would not have accepted the burnt offering and grain offering from our hands, nor would He have shown us all these things, nor would He have told us what is to come."

verses.latin: Peperit igitur mulier filium, et vocavit nomen eius Samson. Crevitque puer, et benedixit ei Dominus.
verses.english: So the woman gave birth to a son, and she named him Samson. The boy grew, and the Lord God blessed him.

verses.latin: Et cœpit spiritus Domini esse cum eo in castris Dan inter Saraa et Esthaol.
verses.english: And the Spirit of the Lord God began to be with him in the camp of Dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.

verses.latin: Abiit ergo Samson in Thamnatha: viditque ibi mulierem de filiabus Philisthinorum.
verses.english: Samson then went down to Timnah. There, he saw a young woman who was one of the daughters of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Et descendit, et indicavit patri suo et matri suae, dicens: Vidi mulierem in Thamnatha de filiabus Philisthinorum: nunc ergo mihi eam uxorem accipite.
verses.english: He returned and told his father and his mother, saying: 'I saw a young woman in Timnah, one of the daughters of the Philistines. So now, get her for me as my wife.'

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ei pater ejus et mater: Numquid non est mulier de filiabus fratrum tuorum, et de omni populo tuo, ut de Philisthinorum gentis incircumcisorum femina accipias uxorem? Dixitque Samson ad patrem suum: Hanc mihi accipe, quia placuit oculis meis.
verses.english: His father and mother said to him: 'Is there not a young woman among the daughters of your relatives, or among all your people, so that you would take a wife from among the uncircumcised Philistines?' But Samson said to his father: 'Get this one for me, because she pleases my eyes.'

verses.latin: Parentes autem ejus nescierunt quod a Domino fieret hoc, et quæreret occasionem contra Philisthinos: eo enim tempore Philisthim dominabantur Israëli.
verses.english: But his parents did not know that this was from the Lord, who was seeking an opportunity against the Philistines. For at that time, the Philistines ruled over Israel.

verses.latin: Descendit itaque Samson cum patre suo et matre in Thamnatha. Cumque venissent ad vineas oppidi, apparuit catulus leonis adversum eum, rugiens.
verses.english: So Samson went down with his father and mother to Timnah. When they came to the vineyards near the town, a young lion roared and sprang out against him.

verses.latin: Et irruit spiritus Domini in Samson, et scidit leonem quasi hœdum, nihil habens in manu: et hoc noluit indicare patri et matri suæ.
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord came mightily upon Samson, and he tore the lion apart as if it were a young goat, even though he had nothing in his hand. He did not want to tell his father or his mother what he had done.

verses.latin: Descenditque et locutus est cum muliere, quæ placuerat oculis ejus.
verses.english: He went down again and spoke with the young woman who had pleased his eyes.

verses.latin: Post aliquot dies, reversus ut acciperet eam, declinavit ut videret cadaver leonis: et ecce examen apum in ore leonis, et favus mellis.
verses.english: After some days, when he returned to take her as his wife, he turned aside to see the lion's carcass. And behold, there was a swarm of bees in the lion's mouth, and a honeycomb.

verses.latin: Cumque abstulisset favum mellis de corpore leonis, comedebat in via: et veniens ad patrem suum et matrem, dedit eis, qui comederunt: nec voluit eis indicare quod de corpore leonis mel abstulisset.
verses.english: When he had taken the honeycomb from the lion's body, he ate some as he walked. When he came to his father and mother, he gave some to them, and they ate it. But he did not want to tell them that he had taken the honey from the lion's body.

verses.latin: Descendit itaque pater ejus ad mulierem, et fecit Samson convivium ibi: sic enim facere consueverant juvenes.
verses.english: So his father went down to the young woman's house. Samson then held a wedding feast there, for it was customary for young men to do so.

verses.latin: Cumque vidissent eum cives illius loci, triginta socios dederunt ei.
verses.english: When the local citizens saw him, they gave him thirty companions.

verses.latin: Dixitque Samson ad eos: Proponam vobis problema, quod si solveritis mihi in septem diebus convivii, et verum dixeritis, dabo vobis triginta sindones et totidem tunicas.
verses.english: Samson said to them: 'I will propose a riddle to you. If you can solve it for me within the seven days of the feast and tell me the correct answer, I will give you thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothing.'

verses.latin: Sin autem non potueritis solvere, vos dabitis mihi triginta sindones et totidem tunicas. Qui responderunt: Proponas problema ut audiamus.
verses.english: 'But if you cannot solve it, then you will give me thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothing.' They replied: 'Propose your riddle so we can hear it.'

verses.latin: Dixitque eis: De comedente exivit cibus, et de forti egressa est dulcedo. Nec potuerunt per tres dies conjicere propositum.
verses.english: So he said to them: 'Out of the eater came something to eat, and out of the strong came something sweet.' And they could not solve the riddle for three days.

verses.latin: Cumque advenisset dies quartus, dixerunt uxori Samson: Blandire viro tuo, et elice ab eo quid sit problema: alioquin igne comburemus te et domum patris tui. Numquid ad delendas nos vocati estis ad nuptias?
verses.english: When the fourth day came, they said to Samson's wife: 'Coax your husband and get him to tell you what the riddle means. Otherwise, we will burn you and your father's house with fire. Were we invited to this wedding just to be impoverished?'

verses.latin: Flebat ergo uxor Samson coram eo, et dicebat: Odio habes me, et non diligis: hinc est quod problema, quod proposuisti civibus meis, non indicasti mihi. Qui respondit: Patri meo et matri meæ nolui dicere, et tibi tacerem?
verses.english: So Samson's wife wept before him and said: 'You hate me and do not love me! That is why you have not told me the riddle you proposed to my countrymen!' He replied: 'I wouldn't even tell my own father and mother, so why should I tell you?'

verses.latin: Attamen per septem dies convivii flebat ad eum: tandemque septimo die victus ejus molestiis, indicavit. Quæ statim cunctis civibus indicavit.
verses.english: Yet she wept before him for the remaining seven days of the feast. At last, on the seventh day, overcome by her nagging, he told her. She immediately told all her countrymen the answer.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ei cives ante solis occasum die septimo: Quid dulcius melle? Et quid fortius leone? Qui ait eis: Nisi arassetis in vitula mea, non invenissetis propositionem meam.
verses.english: So before the sun set on the seventh day, the men of the city said to him: 'What is sweeter than honey? And what is stronger than a lion?' He said to them: 'If you had not plowed with my heifer, you would not have solved my riddle.'

verses.latin: Irruit itaque spiritus Domini in Samson, et descendit Ascalonem, et interfecit ibi triginta viros, tollensque spolia eorum, dedit vestes his qui problema solvebant. Iratusque nimio furore, regressus est in domum patris sui.
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord came mightily upon Samson, and he went down to Ashkelon. There, he killed thirty men. He took their spoils and gave their garments to those who had solved the riddle. Then, in a fit of intense rage, he returned to his father's house.

verses.latin: Uxor autem Samson accepit amicum ejus, qui fuerat socius.
verses.english: But Samson's wife was given to his companion, who had been his best man.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post aliquot dies, in tempore messis triticeae, et visitavit Samson uxorem suam in pullo hædorum, et dixit: Ingrediar ad uxorem meam in cubiculum. Cui vir ejus non permisit.
verses.english: Now, after some time had passed, during the wheat harvest, Samson visited his wife, bringing a young goat as a gift. And he said: 'I am going into my wife's room.' But her husband (Samson's father-in-law) did not allow him to.

verses.latin: Dixitque socer ejus: Putavi quod odisses eam, et ideo dedi eam amico tuo: sed habet soror ejus minor pulchrior, accipe hanc pro illa.
verses.english: And her father-in-law, Samson's father-in-law, said: 'I thought you truly hated her, so I gave her to your friend. But look, her younger sister is more beautiful! Take her instead.'

verses.latin: Cui respondit Samson: A præsenti tempore non est quod me reprehendat Philisthæus: faciam enim vobis malum.
verses.english: Samson replied: 'From this moment on, no Philistine can blame me for anything. I will certainly bring harm upon you people.'

verses.latin: Et abiit Samson, et cepit trecentas vulpes, caudasque earum junxit ad caudas, et posuit inter medias caudas tædas.
verses.english: So Samson went and caught three hundred foxes. He then tied their tails together, two by two, and placed a torch between each pair of tied tails.

verses.latin: Quibus accensis igne, dimisit ut discurrerent per segetem Philisthinorum: qui statim succensi sunt, tam frugibus quæ erant jam collectæ, quam his quæ adhuc stabant in stipula. Ita igne consumptæ sunt omnis regio Philisthinorum.
verses.english: He lit the torches, then released the foxes so they would run through the Philistine fields. Immediately, the crops caught fire—both the harvested grain that was already stacked, and the grain still standing in the stalks. Thus, the entire Philistine region was consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque Philisthæi: Quis hoc fecit? Responsum est: Samson, gener Thamnathæi, quia tulit uxorem ejus, et alteri tradidit. Et ascenderunt Philisthæi, et interfecerunt eam, et patrem ejus igni.
verses.english: The Philistines asked, 'Who did this?' They were told: 'Samson, the son-in-law of the man from Timnah, because he took Samson's wife and gave her to another man.' So the Philistines went up and killed her and her father by fire.

verses.latin: Quibus Samson ait: Quoniam fecistis rem crudelissimam, non quiescam donec de vobis ultus fuero.
verses.english: Samson said to them: 'Since you have done such a cruel thing, I will not rest until I have had my revenge on you.'

verses.latin: Percussitque eos ingenti plaga, ut curvarentur et succumberent: et descendens mansit in spelunca petræ Etam.
verses.english: Then he struck them with a mighty blow, causing them to be crippled and fall. Afterward, he went down and stayed in the cave of the rock of Etam.

verses.latin: Igitur ascenderunt Philisthæi in terra Juda, et castrametati sunt in Lechi, hoc est, in Maxilla.
verses.english: Therefore, the Philistines went up into the land of Judah and camped at Lehi—which means 'Jawbone Hill'.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ad eos tribus Juda: Cur ascendistis adversum nos? Qui responderunt: Ut ligemus Samson, et reddamus ei quæ in nos operatus est.
verses.english: The men of the tribe of Judah asked them: 'Why have you come up against us?' The Philistines answered: 'We have come to tie up Samson and make him pay for what he has done to us.'

verses.latin: Descenderunt ergo tria millia virorum de Juda, et de petra Etam, et dixerunt ad Samson: Nescis quod Philisthæi dominantur nostri? Quare hoc nobis facere voluisti? Cui respondit: Sicut fecerunt mihi, sic feci illis.
verses.english: So three thousand men from Judah went down from the rock of Etam and said to Samson: 'Don't you know that the Philistines rule over us? Why did you want to do this to us?' He replied: 'Just as they did to me, so I did to them.'

verses.latin: Dixeruntque: Ad ligandum te venimus, et ut tradamus te in manus Philisthinorum. Cui Samson: Jurate, ait, mihi quod non interficiatis me.
verses.english: They said: 'We have come to tie you up and hand you over to the Philistines.' Samson said to them: 'Swear to me that you yourselves will not kill me.'

verses.latin: Responderunt: Non interficiemus te: sed ligantes trademus te. Ligaverunt ergo eum duobus novis funibus, et tulerunt de petra Etam.
verses.english: They responded: 'No, we will not kill you; we will only tie you up and hand you over.' So they tied him with two new ropes and took him from the rock of Etam.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset ad locum maxillae, et Philisthæi vociferantes occurrissent ei, irruit spiritus Domini in Samson: et sicut arula lino solvitur, flamma tacto, sic abrupti sunt vincula ejus, et ligaturæ ejus diffluxerunt de manibus ejus.
verses.english: When he came to the place called Jawbone Hill, and the Philistines rushed to meet him, shouting in triumph, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly came upon Samson with overwhelming power. His ropes became like burned flax, which easily comes apart at the touch of fire. His bonds simply melted away from his hands.

verses.latin: Inventaque maxilla asini recens, quæ jacebat, arripiens illam, interfecit in ea mille viros.
verses.english: He found a fresh jawbone of a donkey lying there. Grabbing it, he used it to kill a thousand men.

verses.latin: Et dixit: In maxilla asini, in maxilla pulli asini, interfeci mille viros.
verses.english: And Samson said: 'With the jawbone of a donkey, indeed, with the jawbone of a young donkey, I have killed a thousand men!'

verses.latin: Cumque hæc verba finisset, projecit maxillam de manu, et vocavit nomen loci illius, Ramathlechi, id est, Elevatio maxillae.
verses.english: When he had finished speaking these words, he threw the jawbone from his hand and called that place Ramath-Lehi, which means 'Jawbone Elevation' or 'Hill of the Jawbone'.

verses.latin: Sitis autem valida oppressit eum: clamansque ad Dominum, ait: Tu dedisti in manu servi tui salutem hanc maximam: et ecce morior in siti, et cadam in manus incircumcisorum.
verses.english: But then a terrible thirst oppressed him. He cried out to the Lord, saying: 'You, Lord, have given this great deliverance into the hand of your servant. And now, look, I am dying of thirst and will fall into the hands of these uncircumcised enemies!'

verses.latin: Aperuit itaque Dominus molarem dentem in maxilla asini, et egressæ sunt ex eo aquæ: quibus haustis, refocillavit spiritum, et vires recepit. Propter hoc, appellatum est nomen loci illius, Fons invocantis, qui est in maxilla, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: So the Lord opened a spring from a hollow place in the jawbone (or perhaps, a hollow in Lehi itself), and water flowed out from it. After Samson drank from it, his spirit was revived, and he regained his strength. Because of this, that place was called En-hakkore, meaning 'Spring of the One Who Calls,' which is at Jawbone Hill, even to this present day.

verses.latin: Et judicavit Israëlem in diebus Philisthinorum viginti annis.
verses.english: And Samson judged Israel for twenty years during the time of the Philistines' dominance.
