verses.latin: Igitur egressi sunt omnes filii Israel, de Dan usque Bersabee, et terra Galaad, et congregati quasi vir unus ad Dominum in Maspha.
verses.english:
Then all the sons of Israel went out, from Dan all the way to Beersheba in the south, and from the land of Gilead in the east.
They gathered as one man before the Lord in Mizpah, in a solemn assembly.

verses.latin: Convenitque omnis angulus populorum, et cunctae tribus Israel in ecclesiam populi Dei, quadringenta millia peditum pugnatorum, et virorum belligerantium.
verses.english:
All the leading men of the people came, and all the tribes of Israel formed an assembly of God's people.
There were four hundred thousand foot soldiers, all experienced men of war.

verses.latin: Nec mora, sed et filii Benjamin audierunt quod ascendissent filii Israel in Maspha.
verses.english: Without delay, even the sons of Benjamin heard that the sons of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque filii Israel: Dicite quomodo factum est scelus hoc?
verses.english: Then the sons of Israel said: "Tell us, how did this wickedness happen?"

verses.latin: Respondit Levites, maritus uxoris impudicae: Venio in Gabaa Benjaminitarum cum uxore mea, ut illic maneremus.
verses.english: The Levite, the husband of the dishonored concubine, responded: "I came to Gibeah of the Benjaminites with my concubine so we could stay there for the night.

verses.latin: Et ecce surrexerunt super me viri urbis illius ignem volentes inferre domui meae, et concubinam meam violare, et crudeliter interficere.
verses.english:
But behold, the men of that city rose up against me.
They intended to burn down my house, to violate my concubine, and to brutally kill her.

verses.latin: Quam cum oppressam contumeliis per totam noctem vidissem, tandem mortuam ad vestigia domus meae dimisi.
verses.english: When I saw that she had been horribly abused throughout the entire night, I finally let her go, dead, at the doorstep of my house.

verses.latin: Tulique eam, et in partes concidi, misique in omnes terminos possessionis vestrae: quia nec cogitastis quid patraverit scelus, nec in Israel tale quid factum est.
verses.english:
So I took her, and cut her into pieces, and sent her to all the borders of your inheritance throughout Israelite territory.
I did this because no one had even considered what a wicked deed was committed, and no such thing has ever happened in Israel before.

verses.latin: Ecce adestis, omnes filii Israel, decernite quid facere debeatis.
verses.english:
Behold, you are all here, sons of Israel.
Decide what you ought to do.

verses.latin: Sumamus denas virorum per centenas ex omnibus tribubus Israel, et centenas per millenas, et millenas ex decem millibus: ut parent cibaria exercitui, et eant, ac percutiant urbem Gabaa Benjamin, pro eo quod turpitudinem in Israel fecerunt.
verses.english:
Let us take ten men out of every hundred from all the tribes of Israel, and a hundred out of every thousand, and a thousand out of every ten thousand.
These men will prepare provisions for the army.
Then the rest of the army will go and strike the city of Gibeah of Benjamin, because they have committed such a disgraceful thing in Israel.

verses.latin: Convenit itaque omnis Israel ad civitatem quasi vir unus, eadem mente et consilio.
verses.english: So all Israel assembled against the city as one man, with the same mind and purpose.

verses.latin: Miseruntque nuntios ad omnem tribum Benjamin, qui dicerent: Cur tantum scelus in vobis repertum est?
verses.english: And they sent messengers to all the tribe of Benjamin, saying: "Why has such wickedness been found among you?"

verses.latin: Tradite homines Gabaa filios Belial, qui hoc flagitium perpetrarunt, ut moriantur, et auferatur malum de Israel. Qui noluerunt fratrum suorum filiorum Israel audire mandata, atque verba, sed in unum convenerunt de civitatibus suis, ut auxilio essent habitatoribus Gabaa.
verses.english:
Hand over the men of Gibeah, those sons of Belial (a term for worthless and wicked men), who committed this atrocity, so they may die and evil may be removed from Israel."
But the Benjaminites were unwilling to listen to the commands and words of their brothers, the sons of Israel.
Instead, they gathered together from their cities to help the inhabitants of Gibeah.

verses.latin: Et numerati sunt de singulis urbibus Benjamin, qui armati ad pugnam venerant, viginti sex millia virorum absque habitatoribus Gabaa, qui septingenti viri fortissimi fuerunt.
verses.english:
And those counted from the cities of Benjamin who had come armed for battle were twenty-six thousand men.
This number did not include the inhabitants of Gibeah, who were seven hundred very strong men.

verses.latin: De universis autem populis sexcentis viris electis, qui utraque manu pro dextra utebantur, et sic fundis lapides jecerunt, ut certum esset nullum omnino errari.
verses.english:
From all these people, there were six hundred chosen men who used both hands as if they were their right hand (meaning they were ambidextrous or extremely skilled).
They hurled stones with slings so precisely that not a single one would miss its target.

verses.latin: Absque his quoque de Israelis viris inventa sunt quadringenta millia pugnatorum, viri, id est, bellatores, qui omnia in procinctu habebant.
verses.english: Apart from these, there were also found among the men of Israel four hundred thousand fighting men, that is, warriors, who were all ready for battle.

verses.latin: Hi erant, qui in unum locum convenerant.
verses.english: These were the ones who had gathered in one place.

verses.latin: Veneruntque filii Israel, et consulebant Dominum dicentes: Quis de nobis erit dux certaminis contra filios Benjamin? Quibus Dominus respondit: Judas primus ascendet.
verses.english:
Then the sons of Israel came and consulted the Lord, saying: "Who among us shall go up first to battle against the sons of Benjamin?"
To them the Lord responded: "Judah will go up first."

verses.latin: Statimque filii Israel surgentes mane, castrametati sunt juxta Gabaa.
verses.english: Immediately the sons of Israel rose early in the morning and encamped near Gibeah.

verses.latin: Et egressi inde ad pugnam contra Benjamin, ordinaverunt aciem contra eos juxta Gabaa.
verses.english: And going out from there to battle against Benjamin, they arrayed themselves for battle against them near Gibeah.

verses.latin: Egressique filii Benjamin de Gabaa, occiderunt de filiis Israel eo die viginti duo millia viros.
verses.english: And the sons of Benjamin came out from Gibeah and on that day killed twenty-two thousand men of the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Rursum filii Israel, confisi in Domino Deo suo, et in virtute sua, in eodem loco in quo prius certaverant, aciem direxerunt.
verses.english: Again, the sons of Israel, trusting in the Lord their God and in their own might and courage, arrayed their battle line in the same place where they had fought before.

verses.latin: Ascenderuntque et fleverunt coram Domino usque ad noctem, consulueruntque eum dicentes: Debeo ultra ire ad pugnam contra filios Benjamin fratres meos, an non? Quibus ille respondit: Ascendite ad eos.
verses.english:
And they went up and wept before the Lord until evening.
They consulted Him, saying: "Should I go up again to battle against the sons of Benjamin, my brothers, or not?"
To them He responded: "Go up against them."

verses.latin: Cumque ascendissent filii Israel altera die contra filios Benjamin, pugnaverunt.
verses.english: And when the sons of Israel went up against the sons of Benjamin on the next day, they fought.

verses.latin: Et egressi Benjamin de portis Gabaa, rursum obtulerunt eis proelium, et occiderunt de Israhel decem et octo millia virorum, omnes pugnatores.
verses.english:
And Benjamin came out from the gates of Gibeah, and again offered them battle.
They killed eighteen thousand men of Israel, all of them fighting men.

verses.latin: Unde omnes filii Israel venerunt ad civitatem Bethel, et fleverunt coram Domino sedentes ibi usque ad vesperum, et afflicti sunt in jejunio illo die, obtuleruntque holocausta, et pacificas victimas coram eo.
verses.english:
Therefore all the sons of Israel went up to the city of Bethel.
They wept before the Lord, sitting there until evening, and they afflicted themselves with fasting on that day.
They offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before Him.

verses.latin: Et interrogaverunt eum super salutem suam. In diebus illis arca fœderis Dei erat in Bethel,
verses.english:
And they inquired of Him concerning their deliverance and welfare.
In those days, the Ark of the Covenant of God was in Bethel,

verses.latin: et Phinees filius Eleazari filii Aaron praepositus domus. Et consuluerunt Dominum atque dixerunt: Exire debemus ultra ad pugnam contra Benjamin fratres nostros, an quiescere? Ait illis Dominus: Ascendite, quia cras tradam illos in manus vestras.
verses.english:
and Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, was in charge of the house of God (the sanctuary).
And they consulted the Lord and said: "Should we go out again to battle against Benjamin our brothers, or should we stop?"
The Lord said to them: "Go up, for tomorrow I will deliver them into your hands."

verses.latin: Itaque surrexerunt filii Israel postera die, et perrexerunt in Gabaa, et circumdederunt illam.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel rose up on the next day and went against Gibeah, and surrounded it.

verses.latin: Et tertio contra Benjamin per ordines suos aciem direxerunt, sicut et prius.
verses.english: And for a third time, they arrayed their battle lines against Benjamin, in their divisions, just as before.

verses.latin: Sed et filii Benjamin audacter egressi de civitate, instructi sunt ad occursum eorum, et coeperunt vulnerare, et interficere de populo sicut primo et secundo die, qui fugiebant ex omnibus civitatibus, et pergebant in via grandi, et per diversa loca, ita ut triginta viros interficerent.
verses.english:
But the sons of Benjamin boldly came out of the city and arrayed themselves to meet them.
They began to wound and kill some of the people, just as on the first and second days.
These were those who were fleeing from all the cities, and going along the highway and through various places, so that they killed about thirty men.

verses.latin: Sperantes quod sicut prius eos effugarent. Qui dum simularent fugam, Benjamin sequentes, alios de via in civitatem, alios in agros compellebant.
verses.english:
The Benjaminites hoped that they would rout them as before.
But while the Israelites pretended to flee, the Benjaminites, pursuing them, were drawing some away from the highway towards the city, and others into the fields.

verses.latin: At vero filii Israel ad locum qui vocatur Baaltamar, ex omnibus suis simul in unum convenerunt: erantque insidiæ eorum paulatim se ostendentes de locis suis, id est, de spelunca Gabaa.
verses.english:
But the sons of Israel gathered all their forces together at the place called Baal-tamar.
And their ambush was gradually revealing itself from its hiding places, that is, from the hidden area of Gibeah.

verses.latin: Venerunt itaque contra Gabaa de universo Israel decem millia pugnatorum electorum, et coepit durum instare certamen. Nec intellegebant Benjamin quod immineret sibi interitus.
verses.english:
So ten thousand chosen warriors from all Israel came against Gibeah, and the battle began to rage fiercely.
But Benjamin did not understand that destruction was imminent for them.

verses.latin: Percussitque Dominus Benjamin in conspectu filiorum Israel, et interfecerunt de illis in illo die viginti quinque millia, et centum viros, omnes pugnatores.
verses.english:
And the Lord struck Benjamin down before the sons of Israel.
On that day, they killed twenty-five thousand one hundred men of Benjamin, all of them fighting men.

verses.latin: Intellexerunt enim filii Benjamin quod a se in fugam conversi, filii Israel locum darent insidiis, quas posuerant.
verses.english: For the sons of Benjamin realized that the sons of Israel, by turning in flight from them, were making way for the ambush which Israel had set.

verses.latin: Tunc illi qui in insidiis erant, subito irruentes super Gabaa, et pertransientes fusi sunt, et omnes interfecerunt gladiis civitatis.
verses.english:
Then those who were in ambush suddenly rushed upon Gibeah, and spread out as they passed through.
They killed everyone in the city with swords.

verses.latin: Signum autem datum ab Israelis exercitu, erat ut postquam cepissent civitatem, ignem accenderent, ut de sublimi arderet in caelum, et indicaret imminentem victoriam.
verses.english: Now the signal given by the army of Israel was that after they had captured the city, they would set it on fire, so that it would burn high up into the sky and indicate their impending victory.

verses.latin: Et cum jam filii Israel in bello versarentur, Benjamin quoque coepit cernere quod cineres ascenderent de civitate, et cladem quam ante latebat, nunc manifeste sciret.
verses.english:
And when the sons of Israel were already engaged in battle, Benjamin also began to see that smoke was rising from the city.
They now clearly knew the disaster that had previously been hidden from them.

verses.latin: Et illi quidem, qui fugam simulabant, videntes hoc, fortius restitissent Benjamin, qui perterriti, fugere coeperunt in civitatem, sed nec hoc illis profuit, nec evadere potuerunt, quin ab eis, qui jam ceperant civitatem, interficerentur.
verses.english:
And indeed, those who had feigned flight, seeing this, resisted Benjamin more strongly.
The Benjaminites, terrified, began to flee towards the city, but this did not help them.
Nor could they escape from being killed by those who had already captured the city.

verses.latin: Igitur egressi sunt omnes filii Israël de Baala, et convenerunt quasi vir unus de Dan usque Bersabee, et terra Galaad, ad Dominum in Maspha.
verses.english: Therefore, all the children of Israel came out from Baala, and they gathered as one unified man, from Dan to Beersheba, and even from the land of Gilead, before the Lord in Mizpah.

verses.latin: Omnesque principes universarum gentium, et tribus Israël, steterunt in ecclesia populi Dei, quadringenta millia peditum pugnatorum, et armatorum.
verses.english: And all the chiefs of the Israelite tribes, and the tribes themselves, stood in the assembly of God's people. There were four hundred thousand armed foot soldiers, ready for battle.

verses.latin: Audieruntque filii Beniamin, quod ascendissent filii Israël in Maspha.
verses.english: Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.

verses.latin: Et ilico locutus est Levites vir uxoris occisae: Hæc, inquit, est abominanda res, et facinus execrabile, quod patratum est in Israel: ego et concubina mea cum essemus in Gabaa, quæ est in tribu Beniamin, ut pernoctaremus, ecce viri illius civitatis circumventi sunt, ut interficerent me, et interfecerunt concubinam meam, ita ut mortua sit.
verses.english: And immediately, the Levite, the husband of the murdered woman, spoke: 'This is an abominable thing,' he said, 'and an execrable crime that has been perpetrated in Israel. My concubine and I were in Gibeah, which is in the tribe of Benjamin, to spend the night. And behold, the men of that city surrounded us, intending to kill me, and they violently killed my concubine, so that she died.'

verses.latin: Irrueruntque super domum meam, et rapuerunt concubinam meam, et afflixerunt usque ad mortem.
verses.english: They burst into my home, seized my concubine, and violently abused her until she died.

verses.latin: Divisi ergo cadaver ejus in duodecim partes, et misi in omnes terminos Israël: ut scilicet innotesceret scelus, quod tam nefandum facinus patratum est in Israel.
verses.english: Therefore, I divided her dead body into twelve parts and sent them into all the borders of Israel, so that the atrocity and the unspeakable evil committed in Israel would become known to everyone.

verses.latin: Ecce omnes vos filii Israël, discernite quid agere debeatis.
verses.english: Now, behold, all of you, children of Israel, discern what you ought to do about this.

verses.latin: Et surrexit omnis populus quasi vir unus, dicens: Non ibimus in tabernacula nostra, nec recedemus unusquisque in domum suam:
verses.english: And all the people rose up as one unified man, saying: 'We will not go to our tents, nor will any of us return to his home.'

verses.latin: sed hoc est consilium, quod in praesentiarum capere debemus contra Gabaa:
verses.english: 'But this is the plan that we ought to take now against Gibeah:'

verses.latin: Decem viri eligantur ex centum per omnes tribus Israël, et centum de mille, et mille de decem millibus, ut afferant cibaria exercitui, et pugnantes possint promereri pro Gabaa Beniamin, quod meretur.
verses.english: 'Let ten men be chosen out of every hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, and a hundred out of a thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand, to bring provisions for the army. Then the fighters can inflict upon Gibeah of Benjamin what it deserves.'

verses.latin: Convenerunt itaque universi homines Israël ad civitatem quasi vir unus, et una mente.
verses.english: So, all the men of Israel assembled against the city as one unified man, and with one mind.

verses.latin: Miseruntque nuntios ad omnem tribum Beniamin, qui dicerent: Quid tantum scelus in vobis perpetratum est?
verses.english: And they sent messengers to the entire tribe of Benjamin, to say: 'Why has such a great crime been perpetrated among you?'

verses.latin: Tradite homines de Gabaa, qui hoc facinus et scelus perpetrarunt, ut moriantur, et auferatur malum de Israël. Qui noluerunt fratrum suorum filiorum Israël verbis acquiescere:
verses.english: 'Hand over the men of Gibeah who committed this vile deed and crime, so that they may die, and evil may be removed from Israel.' But the sons of Benjamin were unwilling to listen to the words of their Israelite brothers.

verses.latin: sed de cunctis urbibus suis in unum convenerunt, et pariter contra impugnantes se venire decreverunt.
verses.english: Instead, they gathered from all their cities into one place, and together they resolved to come out against those attacking them.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque millia de populo pugnatorum, et armatorum, absque habitatoribus Gabaa, qui erant septingenti viri robustissimi.
verses.english: There were twenty-five thousand armed fighters from the tribe of Benjamin, besides the seven hundred very strong men who were inhabitants of Gibeah.

verses.latin: Ex omnibus adunatis, septingenti viri fortissimi, ita sinistra ut dextra proeliantes: et sic fundis lapides ad certum jacientes, ut capillum unum percutere possent, et non fallerent.
verses.english: Among all those gathered, there were seven hundred very strong men who could fight with either hand as well as with their right, and they could accurately hurl stones with slings, able to strike a single hair without missing.

verses.latin: De reliquis quoque Israël, absque filiis Beniamin, erant quadringenta millia pugnatorum, et armatorum, omnes viri bellatores.
verses.english: From the rest of Israel also, apart from the children of Benjamin, there were four hundred thousand armed fighters, all of them men of war.

verses.latin: Qui surgentes venerunt in domum Dei, id est, in Bethel, et consuluerunt eum, dicentes: Quis de nostro exercitu primus debet ascendere ad pugnam contra filios Beniamin? Respondit Dominus: Judas primus ascendet.
verses.english: They rose up and came to the house of God, that is, to Bethel, and consulted Him, saying: 'Who among our army should go up first to battle against the sons of Benjamin?' The Lord answered: 'Judah will go up first.'

verses.latin: Statimque de nocte surrexerunt, et castrametati sunt juxta Gabaa.
verses.english: And immediately they rose up in the night and encamped near Gibeah.

verses.latin: Et cum instruxisset exercitum Israël contra Beniamin, coeperunt proelium contra illos.
verses.english: And when the army of Israel had arrayed itself against Benjamin, they began the battle against them.

verses.latin: Egressique filii Beniamin de Gabaa, occiderunt de filiis Israël decem et octo millia viros fortissimos.
verses.english: And the children of Benjamin came out of Gibeah and killed eighteen thousand very strong men from the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Unde rursum filii Israël et fortiter ausi sunt, ut ibidem ubi prius certamen inierant, proeliari.
verses.english: From this, the children of Israel gathered courage again, resolving to fight in the same place where they had first engaged in battle.

verses.latin: Ascenderuntque et fleverunt coram Domino usque ad noctem, et consuluerunt eum, dicentes: Debemus ultra procedere ad pugnam contra filios Beniamin fratres nostros, an quiescere? Quibus ille respondit: Ascendite ad eos.
verses.english: And they went up and wept before the Lord until night, and consulted Him, saying: 'Should we proceed further to battle against our brothers, the sons of Benjamin, or should we stop?' To them He responded: 'Go up against them.'

verses.latin: Cumque mane altero progressi essent, ad certamen contra filios Beniamin,
verses.english: And when they had advanced on the second morning, to battle against the sons of Benjamin,

verses.latin: egressi filii Beniamin de portis Gabaa, occiderunt de filiis Israël decem et octo millia viros fortissimos, armatos ad pugnam.
verses.english: the sons of Benjamin came out from the gates of Gibeah and killed eighteen thousand more very strong, armed men from the children of Israel who were ready for battle.

verses.latin: Unde omnes filii Israël venerunt ad domum Dei, et sedentes ibi fleverunt coram Domino: jejunaveruntque in die illo usque ad vesperam, et obtulerunt ei holocausta et pacificas victimas.
verses.english: Because of this, all the children of Israel came to the house of God, and sitting there, they wept before the Lord. They fasted on that day until evening and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings to Him.

verses.latin: Consulueruntque Dominum in diebus illis. Ibi enim erat arca fœderis Domini.
verses.english: And they consulted the Lord in those days, for the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord was there.

verses.latin: Et Phinees filius Eleazari filii Aaron, stabat coram eo: et interrogaverunt: Si ultra debemus procedere ad pugnam contra filios Beniamin fratres nostros, an quiescere? Dixit Dominus: Ascendite, cras enim tradam eos in manus vestras.
verses.english: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, stood before it. And they inquired: 'Should we proceed further to battle against our brothers, the sons of Benjamin, or should we stop?' The Lord said: 'Go up, for tomorrow I will deliver them into your hands.'

verses.latin: Itaque posuerunt filii Israël insidias per circuitum urbis Gabaa.
verses.english: Therefore, the children of Israel set ambushes all around the city of Gibeah.

verses.latin: Et cum tertia vice sicut semel et bis, contra Beniamin conserta esset pugna,
verses.english: And when the battle had been joined against Benjamin for the third time, just as it had been once and twice before,

verses.latin: et illi egressi essent de civitate, cæpto solito itinere, fugientes persequerentur, cæderentque ex eis triginta viros, sicut prius: putaverunt se victos, et Beniamin jam evadere posse de manibus eorum.
verses.english: and the Benjaminites had come out of the city, taking their usual route, they pursued those fleeing and killed about thirty men, just as before. The Israelites thought they were defeated, and Benjamin could now escape from their hands.

verses.latin: Qui autem insidiis tenebantur in locis vicinis Gabaa, cum viderent fugientes ad Gabaa, et pugnantes eodem modo, quo et ipsi fugiebant, dixerunt: Fugiamus, et non amplius persequamur, ne, sicut et ipsi, in eodem loco vulneremur.
verses.english: However, those who were hidden in ambush in the nearby places around Gibeah, when they saw the Israelites fleeing toward Gibeah, and the Benjaminites fighting in the same way they themselves were fleeing, said: 'Let us flee, and not pursue any further, lest we be wounded in the same place as them.'

verses.latin: Et hi qui fuerant in insidiis, cum viderent eos esse victos, irruerunt super eos a tergo, et occiderunt de his viginti quinque millia virorum.
verses.english: But those who had been in ambush, when they saw the Benjaminites were actually defeated (and retreating into the trap), rushed upon them from behind and killed twenty-five thousand of their men.

verses.latin: Et cum egressi essent de Gabaa ad pugnam, cæperunt ex eis occidere usque ad septingentos viros.
verses.english: And when they had come out from Gibeah for battle, they began to kill from among them up to seven hundred men.

verses.latin: Et tradidit Dominus Beniamin in manus Israël in die illa: et occiderunt ex eis viginti quinque millia, et centum viros, omnes bellatores.
verses.english: And the Lord delivered Benjamin into the hands of Israel on that day. And they killed twenty-five thousand one hundred men from them, all of whom were warriors.

verses.latin: Quia filii Israël cesserunt Beniamin, et putaverunt se victos: qui autem insidiis tenebantur, nuncii, et bellatores, absconderant se circa Gabaa, et omnes parati erant ad pugnam.
verses.english: For the children of Israel had given ground to Benjamin, and the Benjaminites thought they had won. But those who were hidden in ambush, the messengers and warriors, had concealed themselves around Gibeah, and all were ready for the fight.

verses.latin: Et cum filii Israël quasi victi abirent, et Beniamin eos persequeretur fugientes, omnes enim fugientes ad Gabaa se receperant, qui erant in locis abditis juxta Gabaa, irruerunt super eos, et cæperunt eos occidere.
verses.english: And when the children of Israel went away as if defeated, and Benjamin pursued them in their flight (for all those who were fleeing had retreated to Gibeah), those who were in the hidden places near Gibeah rushed upon them and began to kill them.

verses.latin: Et factum est ut, cum fugientes persequerentur, hi qui in insidiis erant, erigerent signum de locis suis, ut scirent fugientes quod jam esset in potestate eorum tota civitas.
verses.english: And it came to pass that, while they were pursuing the fleeing Israelites, those who were in ambush raised a signal from their hidden positions, so that the fleeing Israelites would know that the whole city was now in their power.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt, et occupaverunt civitatem: et cunctos qui erant in ea, interfecerunt in ore gladii.
verses.english: And they came out and occupied the city, and they killed all who were in it with the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: Et cum Beniamin vidisset civitatem occupatam, et jam ignes de civitate ascenderent in cælum, intellexit se victum.
verses.english: And when Benjamin saw the city occupied, and the fires from the city were now ascending into the sky, they understood that they were defeated.

verses.latin: Juraverant quoque filii Israel in Maspha, dicentes: Nullus nostrum dabit filiam suam uxorem de stirpe Benjamin.
verses.english: The sons of Israel had also sworn an oath at Mizpah, saying, "None of us will give his daughter in marriage to a man from the tribe of Benjamin."

verses.latin: Veneruntque omnes ad domum Dei in Silo, ac manentes ibi usque ad vesperam coram Domino, levaverunt vocem suam, et fletu magno coeperunt ululare, dicentes:
verses.english: And all the people came to the House of God at Shiloh, and remained there until evening before the Lord, and they raised their voices and began to wail with great weeping, saying:

verses.latin: Cur, Domine Deus Israel, factum est hoc malum in populo tuo, ut una tribus auferretur de Israel?
verses.english: Why, O Lord, God of Israel, has this evil happened to Your people, that one tribe should be cut off from Israel?

verses.latin: Altera die consurgentes, aedificaverunt altare: obtuleruntque ibi holocausta et pacificas victimas.
verses.english: The next day, rising early, they built an altar there, and offered up burnt offerings and peace offerings.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Quis est de universis tribubus Israel, qui non ascendit ad Dominum in Maspha? grandi enim juramento se astrinxerant interfecturos eos qui non ascendissent.
verses.english: And they said, "Who is there from all the tribes of Israel who did not come up to the Lord at Mizpah?" For they had bound themselves with a solemn oath to kill those who had not come up.

verses.latin: Dolebantque super fratre suo Benjamin, atque aiebant: Una tribus sublata est de Israel:
verses.english: And they grieved over their brother Benjamin, and said, "One tribe has been destroyed from Israel!"

verses.latin: unde uxores accipient? omnes enim in commune juravimus, non daturos nos filias nostras eis.
verses.english: From where will they find wives? For we all swore a common oath that we would not give our daughters to them.

verses.latin: Ideoque dixerunt: Quis est de universis tribubus Israel, qui non ascendit ad Dominum in Maspha? Et ecce inventi sunt habitatores Jabes Galaad, qui ad illum locum non accesserant.
verses.english: Therefore they said, "Who is there from all the tribes of Israel who did not come up to the Lord at Mizpah?" And behold, it was found that the inhabitants of Jabesh-Gilead had not come to that place.

verses.latin: Eo tempore cum essent in Silo, nullus fuerat eorum inventus.
verses.english: At that time, when the Israelites were in Shiloh, none of the people from Jabesh-Gilead had been found among them.

verses.latin: Miserunt itaque decem millia virorum robustissimorum, praeceptumque dederunt eis: Ite, et percutite habitatores Jabes Galaad in ore gladii, tam uxores quam parvulos eorum.
verses.english: So the sons of Israel sent there ten thousand of their strongest men, and gave them this command: "Go and strike down the inhabitants of Jabesh-Gilead with the edge of the sword, both their wives and their little children."

verses.latin: Et hoc erit quod observare debetis: Omne masculinum, et omnes mulieres quae cognoverunt viros, interficite: virgines autem reservate.
verses.english: And this is what you must observe: Every male, and every woman who has known a man, you are to kill; but save the virgins alive to become wives for Benjamin.

verses.latin: Inventaeque sunt de Jabes Galaad quadringentae virgines, quae nescierunt virilem torum: quas ad castra in Silo, in terra Chanaan, adduxerunt.
verses.english: And from Jabesh-Gilead, four hundred virgins were found who had not known a man's bed, and they brought them to the camp at Shiloh, in the land of Canaan.

verses.latin: Miseruntque nuntios ad filios Benjamin, qui erant in petra Remmon, et juraverunt eis pacem.
verses.english: And they sent messengers to the sons of Benjamin, who were in the rock of Rimmon, and promised them peace.

verses.latin: Veneruntque filii Benjamin in illo tempore, et datae sunt eis uxores de Jabes Galaad, quae retentae fuerant: et aliae ultra non sunt repertae, quas similiter traderent.
verses.english: So the sons of Benjamin came at that time, and wives were given to them from the women of Jabesh-Gilead who had been saved; but no more wives were found to be given to the remaining men, as there weren't enough.

verses.latin: Dolebantque universi filii Israel, et de Benjamin, quod unam tribum Domini abstulerat.
verses.english: And all the sons of Israel grieved over Benjamin, because the Lord had allowed one tribe to be diminished from His people.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque majores natu: Quid faciemus de ceteris, qui non acceperunt uxores? omnes feminae de Benjamin interfectae sunt.
verses.english: And the elders said, "What shall we do about the rest of the men who have not received wives? For all the women of Benjamin were killed."

verses.latin: Et hanc sententiam habuerunt: Estote, Benjamin, et maneat in Israel una tribus, ne penitus deleatur.
verses.english: And they held this opinion: "Let Benjamin endure, and let one tribe remain in Israel, so that it may not be utterly destroyed."

verses.latin: Uxores autem de filiabus nostris eis dare non possumus, constricti hoc juramento: Maledictus qui dederit de filiabus suis uxorem Benjamin.
verses.english: But we cannot give them wives from our daughters, for we are bound by this oath: 'Cursed be he who gives a wife from his daughters to Benjamin.'

verses.latin: Et recordati sunt solemnitatis Domini, quae agebatur singulis annis in Silo, quae sita est ad septentrionem urbis Bethel, et ad orientalem plagam viae, quae de Bethel tendit ad Sichem, et ad meridiem oppidi Lebona.
verses.english: And they remembered the solemn festival of the Lord, which was celebrated every year in Shiloh. This city is located north of Bethel, on the east side of the road leading from Bethel to Shechem, and south of the town of Lebonah.

verses.latin: Praeceperuntque filiis Benjamin, dicentes: Ite, et latete in vineis.
verses.english: And they commanded the sons of Benjamin, saying, "Go and hide yourselves in the vineyards."

verses.latin: Et cum videritis filias Silo ad ducendos choros exire, exite repente de vineis, et rapite singuli uxores vobis de filiabus Silo, et abite in terram Benjamin.
verses.english: And when you see the daughters of Shiloh come out to perform their dances, then suddenly come out from the vineyards, and each of you seize a wife for yourselves from the daughters of Shiloh, and then go to the land of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Cumque venerint patres earum, ac fratres, et queri coeperint apud nos, dicemus eis: Ignoscite eis: non enim rapuerunt eas jure bellantium atque victoriam prosequentium, sed deprecantibus nobis dedistis eis: et idcirco a scelere liberi estis.
verses.english: And when their fathers and their brothers come and begin to complain to us, we will say to them: 'Forgive them, for these men did not take them by right of war or as spoils of victory. Rather, you implicitly gave them to them when we begged on their behalf. Therefore, you are free from the guilt of your oath of not giving your daughters.'

verses.latin: Feceruntque filii Benjamin sicut praecessum fuerat eis: et juxta numerum suum, rapuerunt sibi singuli uxores de his quae ducere choros solitae erant: abieruntque in possessionem suam, et aedificantes urbes habitaverunt in eis.
verses.english: So the sons of Benjamin did as they had been instructed: and according to their number, each man seized a wife for himself from those who were accustomed to perform the dances. Then they went into their own possession, and built up cities, and lived in them.

verses.latin: Reversi sunt itaque in illo tempore singuli filiorum Israel in tribus et familias suas: egressique sunt de loco illo, unusquisque in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: And so, at that time, each of the sons of Israel returned to his own tribe and family, and they went out from that place, each to his own tent.

verses.latin: In diebus illis non erat rex in Israel: sed unusquisque quod sibi rectum videbatur, hoc faciebat.
verses.english: In those days there was no king in Israel; but each man did what seemed right in his own eyes, leading to chaos and ungodly acts.
